note: A smashing wine, following in the wake of the great ones in 1984, '85 and '86. Bursting with cherry, plum and prune flavors. Coffee, anise, cedar and tea notes sneak in on the long, complex finish. Intense, but gentle, with tannins rapidly smoothing to a velvety texture. Almost drinkable now. Best from 1996 through 2000. 4,000 cases made.

name: St.-Julien
note: A deep, rich, complex and concentrated wine, with wonderfully complex aromas and intense, sharply focused currant, spice, plum, and black cherry flavors that unfold gently on the palate before the supple tannins wrap around the finish. Simply delicious, but should peak between 1998 and 2004.

name: Sassicaia
note: The stuff that dreams are made of; the greatest Sassicaia ever produced. Has laser-guided flavors and structure. The pure cassis aromas have hints of mint and berries. Full-bodied, with a monumental structure of cassis, mint and vanilla flavors, full, supple tannins and a super-long finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best from 1997 through 2000.

name: Margaux
note: Elegant, complex, seductive and beautifully balanced, with gorgeous plum, raspberry, currant and cedar aromas that hint at all sorts of exotic spices and chocolate on the exceedingly long, smoky finish. A classic, smoothly integrated wine that has the balance to develop well past 2000. 25,000 cases made.

name: Pessac-Léognan
note: Amazingly harmonious, complex and supple, with intense, generous plum, currant, spice, cedar, cherry, and anise flavors that have a wonderful sense of finesse and grace. The tannins are intense, yet graceful, allowing the flavors to pour through on the finish. Best to cellar from 2001 to 2009.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Deep, ripe and powerful, with muscular currant, plum, anise and cherry flavors that are complex and concentrated. This rough-hewn style is focused and intense, with the kind of thick, tight tannins that may require cellaring. Best after 1997. 7,200 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: A muscular, fleshy, full-throttle Bordeaux, packed with plum, currant and anise flavors. Perhaps a bit hot on the finish but generous and concentrated, with nicely integrated tannins; balanced overall for the long haul. Give it until at least 1999 to 2005 for optimum enjoyment. 14,000 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: Deep and dark in color, rich and aromatic, with complex, intense, concentrated black cherry, currant, cedar and spice flavors that have grace and finesse. The flavors echo floral, toasty notes and keep building on the finish. Has a smooth, supple texture and plenty of fine tannins for cellaring through 1998.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Wachenheimer Gerümpel
note: Very sweet and rich, like syrup. Beerenauslese quality. Light gold in color; honey, spice and nectarine aromas; full-bodied and sweet, with syrup, honey, spice and nectarine flavors, medium acidity and a spicy finish. Drinkable now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
note: Massively flavorful, with chewy tannins and gobs of currant, plum, blackberry and cedar aromas and flavors, echoing anise and other spices on the long finish. Enormously fruity, with smoothly integrated tannins that should be marvelous around 1996 to 1998. 700 cases made.

name: Meursault Les Narvaux
note: This is to beg or kill for. Tastes like nectar, with captivating aromas of lilacs, honey, butter and melon. Full-bodied, with multidimensional flavors and toasted notes. Superbly long on the finish. From Lalou Bize-Leroy. Drink now to 1996.

name: Margaux
note: A definition of finesse. So opulent and seductive that the smoothness and delicacy of the texture come almost as a surprise. Explosive blackberry, currant, plum and vanilla aromas are only the beginning, and the subtle echoes of fruit and spice carry over on the featherlight finish. Tannins are beautifully integrated. Should keep improving past 2000. 16,000 cases made.

name: Corton-Charlemagne
note: A masterpiece, with magnificent flavors and structure. Full-bodied, with subtle yet intense straw, earth, lemon and apple aromas. Has superbly balanced, intense flavors and a sublime backbone of acidity. Drink now to 1998.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Folatières
note: There isn't much more you could want in white Burgundy; lemon, butter, toast, hazelnut, ripe apple--the list of characteristics goes on and on. Massive, yet superbly balanced, with great finesse. From Lalou Bize-Leroy. Drink now to 1998.

name: Chambertin-Clos de Bèze
note: An elegant, dynamic wine, with beautifully focused black cherry, currant and toast aromas and flavors that sail across the palate on a smooth structure, echoing on the long finish. A harmonious, gloriously flavorful wine that should be at its best after 1995. 350 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Vieilles Vignes
note: A huge wine. Deep colored, with chocolate-covered cherry aromas and bitter chocolate and cassis flavors. Full-bodied and amazingly concentrated, like crushed grapes. Still like a barrel sample; drink next century.--Châteauneuf-du-Pape retrospective. Best from 2000 through 2010.

name: Charbonneau Red Walla Walla County
note: A very seductive, supple, flavorful Washington red. Spicy oak wraps around a solid core of ripe cherry, currant, and herb flavors. The tannins are abundant, but soft. Tempting now, but could hold until 1997 or beyond. 59 percent Merlot and 41 percent Cabernet Sauvignon. 404 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Strikes a pleasant balance between the opulent, ripe, rich currant and black cherry flavors and the herb and lavish oak notes. Deep, plush and concentrated, with a long, full finish. The firm tannins remind you that this is a young '87; best to cellar this until 1996 or '97. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Signature Reserve
note: The best Chappellet Cabernet in years. Focused and chewy, with powerful currant and berry aromas and flavors shaded by hints of cinnamon, nutmeg and bay leaf, all wrapped in a tight package that should require until 1998 to 2000 to settle all the tannins. 4,900 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Forster Pechstein
note: Undeveloped now, but very rich nonetheless. Light apricot and lemon aromas; full-bodied, with honey, lemon, spice and botrytis flavors. Excellent acidity and finish.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
note: A wine supercharged with fine fruit and an excellent backbone of tannins and acidity. Has stunning aromas of blackberry, cedar, cassis and mint, and a crisp finish. Ready to drink now, but it will improve.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: A big, rich, chewy wine, packed with concentrated cherry, plum, chocolate, cedar and smoke flavors that are tight and complex. Jams in lots of everything, including oak and tannin. Let this one mellow out until 1997. 2,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Paso Robles
note: A great value. Smooth and generous, this ripe wine has marvelous currant and plum flavors and an overlay of rich chocolate and spice notes. Supple, flavorful and utterly charming, with flavor to burn. Drinkable now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington
note: An exciting wine at a good price. Crisp, bright and concentrated, with sharply focused blueberry, currant and raspberry aromas and flavors that gush across the palate. Delicious to drink now, but has the structure and power to age gracefully well into th 7,700 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington
note: Rich, supple and generous, with lavish oak, herb, chocolate, plum and currant flavors that gently unfold on the palate. The tannins are firm but round, making this a delicious wine to enjoy now or keep in the cellar. 900 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Les Cailloux
note: Impressively well crafted and subtle. Like Cheval Blanc; has great finesse and pure fruit. Grapey, raisiny and earthy on the nose and palate, with well-integrated tannins and a focused, grapey, gamy finish.--Châteauneuf-du-Pape retrospective. Best from 1994 through 1996.

name: Pessac-Léognan
note: Dense, ripe and concentrated, with intense, rich currant, blackberry, anise and vanilla flavors that are tight and sharply focused. The well-defined flavors stay with you. Sturdy, with firm tannins and excellent length. Best between 2000 to 2005. 7,600 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: Powerful, remaining graceful enough to present a plush assortment of plum, black cherry and currant flavors shaded by a touch of cedar and spice. The tannins are well integrated, and it's toasty and warm on the finish. Give it until 2000 to settle down. 8,700 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
note: Brilliantly concentrated from beginning to end; oozing with black cherry, currant, plum and anise aromas and flavors that are focused and elegant on the long finish. The tannins are sufficiently integrated to make it drinkable now with hearty food, but it's tough enough to need until 1996 to 2000 to settle down. 4,500 cases made.

name: Nuits-St.-Georges Les Lavières
note: Powerful, rich aromas and flavors of plum, raspberry and nutmeg carry through this mouthfilling, dramatic wine. The broad range of flavors persists on the long finish, and it has a modest level of well-integrated tannins to shed in the cellar. Best after 1993. 750 cases made.

name: Pessac-Léognan
note: Enormously thick, dense and tannic, this subtle Bordeaux is rich, intense and deeply concentrated, with layers of currant, cedar, spice and vanilla flavors that unfold gently on the palate. Needs cellaring until 2000.

name: Vosne-Romanée Clos des Réas
note: Flavorful, graceful and elegant, this beautifully proportioned wine balances plum, raspberry and strawberry flavors against nuances of oak, offering depth and power at the same time. Stash away until 1995 and watch it develop into a beauty. 1,100 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Mendocino County Late Harvest Selected Dried Berry
note: Ripe, spicy and balanced, an elegant dessert wine just oozing with grapefruit, honey, apricot and spice aromas and flavors that keep echoing on the long, generous finish. Drinkable now. 300 cases made.

name: Meursault Genevrières
note: An explosion of aromas and flavors. Has mango, tropical fruit and stone aromas and electrifying apple, mineral and juniper flavors; incredibly lively on the finish. Full-bodied. Drink now to 1996.

name: St.-Estèphe
note: Big, ripe and generous, with excellent harmony of flavor, hinting at cedar, hazelnut and vanilla against a solid backdrop of blackberry and currant. Beautifully proportioned, with fine tannins and gorgeous notes. A real standout in this vintage. Drink after 1998. 30,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Martha's Vineyard
note: Incredibly concentrated, rich and powerful, but still smooth and plush. The flavors of mint, cherry, black currant and spice are deep, long and chewy, with great complexity and polish. Not for everyone, but absolutely full of flavor and beautifully structured, harmonious and complex. Very tempting to drink now, but should improve. Drink now through 2005. 6,938 cases made.

name: Montrachet Marquis de Laguiche
note: Has wonderful aromas and intense, concentrated almond, honey, pear and butter flavors that are tightly reined in now and in need of cellaring. Picks up toast, butter and layers of fruit on the powerful aftertaste. Drink now to 1996 and perhaps beyond.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain
note: Offers a massive concentration of rich currant, cherry, mineral and cedar flavors and finishes with rich, chewy tannins. Uncommonly deep in color, with excellent depth and dimension. Has a long, complex finish, but it's tightly wound and will require cellaring. 2,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Private Reserve
note: Complex, fascinating and beautifully built. Deep currant, cherry, anise, leather, earth and herbal notes vie for attention. It shows a different facet with every sip. The tannins are firm and powerful without being overwhelming. Best to wait until 1998. 15,000 cases made.

name: Vosne-Romanée Au Cros Parantoux
note: Polished, elegant and beautifully spicy, a seductive wine, with a satiny texture and oodles of currant, plum and strawberry flavors that fan out across the palate and keep harmonizing on the finish. Well-integrated oak and tannin components should keep this going for some time. Drink now through 1999. 100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Gisborne Tietjen Vineyard Reserve
note: Buttery and flavorful, with a smooth, almost unctuous texture, dripping with honey and butterscotch notes but weighing in with distinctive pear and pineapple flavors that persist into the finish. This wine evolves on the palate, offering different dimensions of flavor. 4,800 cases made.

name: Condrieu
note: Ripe, rich and seductive, a plush pillow of a wine, with all sorts of apricot, honey, hazelnut, vanilla and floral aromas and flavors that keep taking turns as it extends into a long, long finish. An exotic, substantial wine that offers plenty of pleasure.

name: Ornellaia
note: Silky and refined, like a fine Italian silk scarf. This full-bodied wine is deeply colored, with tar, mint and blackberry aromas, mint and blackberry flavors and a wonderful balance of exquisite tannins and firm acidity. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc.

name: Chassagne-Montrachet Morgeot
note: Elegant and stylish, with intense butter, spice and pear flavors and hints of orange and vanilla. Has great depth and amplitude, revealing layers of flavor and texture with each sip. Amazingly subtle and fruity, with beautifully defined flavors. Delicious. 500 cases made.

name: St.-Estèphe
note: Full-bodied and flavorful, with generous, concentrated plum, currant, cedar and anise aromas and flavors shaded by classy oak notes and fine tannins. Can develop well through 1995 to '99 at least. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
note: This lively, intense style is light enough on its feet to let the grapefruit, nutmeg and vanilla flavors extend over a long finish. Beautifully balanced, with nice pineapple and floral overtones. Drinkable now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Beaune Les Boucherottes
note: Remarkably charming and elegant, with ripe, rich cherry, tea, raspberry and spicy oak flavors that spread out on the palate. The tannins are very fine and well integrated, and the crisp acidity lends life to the flavors on the finish. Persistent from sta 625 cases made.

name: St.-Julien Les Fiefs de Lagrange
note: Elegant and restrained, with pretty, rich, concentrated currant, herb, vanilla and chocolate flavors that gently unfold on the palate, finishing with rich, round, smooth and intense tannins and flavors that linger. Best from 1998 through 2004.

name: Chambolle-Musigny Les Noirots
note: A seductive style, with deep, rich, complex raspberry, strawberry, anise and toasty oak flavors that are engagingly silky and long on the finish. Drink now through 1996. 200 cases made.

name: Pessac-Léognan
note: A pleasant surprise. Lots of bright, lively cherry, raspberry and currant aromas and flavors pervade this beautifully balanced, harmonious wine. The tannins are integrated into the whole structure, turning smooth and elegant on the finish. Tempting now, 16,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
note: Elegant and lively, with a deep concentration of ripe, rich plum, cherry, currant and spice flavors and pretty oak shadings that echo toast and spice notes. Supple enough to drink now, but it has deceptively firm tannins and crisp acidity that bode well for cellearing. Drink from 1994 to 2000. 7,469 cases made.

name: Maurizio Zanella
note: Rich, ripe, round and generous, with a marvelous interplay of oak and plum, currant and cherry aromas and flavors. A spicy finish brings it home smoothly, and the tannins are well integrated. Almost drinkable now, but has the structure to age gracefully. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 1994. 1,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
note: Layers of smoke, vanilla, spice and pear flavors build up and linger on the finish of this toasty, complex, but very young wine that will need until 1995 to loosen up and show its best flavors. Tastes like it will be very elegant when it matures. 2,000 cases made.

name: Volnay
note: Tight, lean, intense and concentrated, with pretty aromas and a solid core of black cherry, currant, berry and raspberry flavors tightly wrapped in firm tannins. A keeper; will probably reach maturity in 1995 or '96. 185 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Limited Bottling
note: Focused and flavorful, a solid mouthful of currant, berry and spice flavors echoing anise and vanilla on the crisp finish. The tannins are balanced for aging from now through '95. 512 cases made.

name: Vougeot
note: Ripe and generous, with lots of blackberry and black cherry aromas and flavors shaded by smoke, nutmeg and a delicate touch of earthiness. Has the intensity and complexity to age well; keep until 1995 to '97. Reasonably priced; not the grand cru. 200 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington Limited Bottling
note: Effusively fruity, with layers of ripe, rich, concentrated blackberry, raspberry, cherry and currant flavors that border on being jammy. The tannins are supple, but sufficient to sustain it another five to 10 years. Drink now through 2000. 1,250 cases made.

name: Morey-St.-Denis Monts Luisants
note: This lively, beautifully focused wine is bursting with delicious plum, raspberry and blackberry aromas and flavors, with a slight meaty edge that adds depth and richness. The flavors echo on a long finish. Approaching drinkability, but try to hold off until 1994 or '95.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
note: Intense and lively, with layers of rich raspberry, cedar, anise, plum and coffee flavors that are well integrated, with complexity and finesse. Not overly tannic, and it has a long, lingering finish. Best to cellar until 1996. 900 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
note: Silky, complex and very Burgundian in style. Smells very toasty and buttery, with rich, almost unctuous pear, butterscotch and spice flavors accented by hazelnut, honey and cream notes. The flavors linger a long time on the finish.  1,553 cases made.

name: Cepparello
note: Subtle on the nose, with elegant blackberry, cherry and licorice aromas, but chewy and powerful on the palate. Excellent potential for cellaring. Full-bodied, with ripe, rich fruit and highly extracted tannins, but shows great elegance. Made from Sangiovese. 2,000 cases made.

name: Vouvray Domaine Le Peu de la Moriette
note: Strikingly fruity and grassy, with rich, concentrated flavors of apple, custard and vanilla. Off-dry, but balanced, with remarkably lively, complex flavors that hint at grapefruit and honey on the finish. Drink now through 1993. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
note: Firm, beautifully structured and rich, with ripe plum, black cherry and anise flavors. A frame of crisp acidity and firm tannins gives this Washington wine a taut balance. Cellar until at least 1995 to 1998 for optimum enjoyment. Classy oak notes linger on the finish. 1,504 cases made.

name: Meursault
note: Rich, bold and flavorful, showing lots of concentration, but maintaining smoothness and elegance, too. Earthy, creamy butterscotch notes accent the ripe pear and apple flavors. Mature and delicious now, but could be aged until at least 1996. 2,500 cases made.

name: Hermitage La Chapelle
note: Jam-packed with ripe, rich plum, currant, black cherry and anise flavors that turn to chocolate and toast on the finish. A beautifully focused, deeply concentrated wine that combines power with finesse. Drink now through 2000. 9,000 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Sonoma County Late Harvest Reserve
note: Very ripe, lush and opulent, with rich apricot, spice and honey aromas and flavors that are long, fresh and balanced on the finish despite the high level of sweetness. Drinkable now, but should be best after 1993. A good value.

name: Syrah Paso Robles
note: Meridian's first Syrah is dense, dark and rich, with spicy, cedary, and focused blackberry and wild raspberry aromas and flavors. A tough wine with a soft heart. Long and elegant, turning complex and especially delicious on the finish. Drinkable now, but cellaring until 1994 couldn't hurt. 4,000 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba
note: Exuberantly fruity and flavorful, supported by crisp acidity and rich tannins, and bursting with blackberry, raspberry and currant flavors that echo on the long finish. Beautifully balanced and built . 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District
note: Ripe and supple, with rich, generous plum, currant, black cherry, chocolate and spicy vanilla notes that are elegant and concentrated, offering finesse and grace. The tannins are smooth and round, and the finish is long and lingering. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Giorgio Regni Riserva
note: A joy to drink, with exuberant fruit and a lovely texture. Superbly balanced, with intense cassis, violet and berry aromas and an excellent balance of intense cherry, cassis and black cherry flavors. Medium-bodied, with a silky texture. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico
note: Classy, elegant and harmonious, with a wonderful balance of fruit. Has very fresh blackberry, tar, freshly cut mushroom, mint and fruit aromas and ripe plum and berry flavors. Full-bodied, with fine tannins and a fine finish. Drink now. 3,330 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley
note: 448 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
note: Has great concentration, built like a great Bordeaux. Deep ruby in color, with vanilla, plum, mint and berry aromas and masses of fruit. Built for aging. Drink now through 1995.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Jack London Vineyard
note: Smells great, and packs plenty of ripe cherry and currant flavor into the tannic structure, which bodes well for the future. Hints of spice and vanilla add nuances to the intense flavor. A deep-colored, beautifully balanced, cellar-worthy wine that should start to show all it has around 1997 to 2000. 6,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Malvedos
note: Ripe, opulent and delicious. Beautifully peppery and fruity in flavor, with a silky smooth texture that belies its high alcohol and young age. A very long finish echoes black pepper and chocolate. Tempting to drink now for its fruitiness, but probably best after 2000. 7,000 cases made.

name: Pauillac Château Haut-Bages-Avérous
note: The second wine of Château Lynch-Bages is very tightly wound, with an elegant core of black cherry, herb and cedar flavors cloaked in tough but fine tannins. This is a wine with obvious style and class that will need until 1998 to 2005 to sort itself out. Not for early drinking.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Corley Reserve
note: A beautiful combination of fruit and oak. Has intense, concentrated, elegant apple, pear and peach flavors neatly shaded by sweet vanilla and honey notes. Polished, long and full on the finish. A real treat. Drink now to 1994. 3,700 cases made.

name: Shiraz Hunter Valley
note: An absolutely delicious wine at a terrific price. It's rich, warm, ripe and generous, with smooth, supple spice, raspberry, blackberry and plum flavors and hints of tobacco, cedar and oak on the finish. Goes down easy. Drink now through 1994. 6,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mount Harlan Jensen
note: Packs in a load of fresh, ultraripe, rich black cherry, currant, herb and spicy earth overtones. Deeply flavored and very concentrated, with smooth, supple tannins and a long, full, fruity finish. A distinctive wine. Drink now through 1997. 437 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington Barrel Fermented
note: Full-bodied, complex, earthy and oaky, but the grapefruit and pear flavors come through on the rich finish. A stylish wine that gets better with each sip. Drinkable now, but should be better around 1993. 700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
note: Ripe, bold and buttery, with layers of honey, pear, peach and nutmeg flavors that are rich and silky-smooth. Oak adds dimension to the flavors. A harmonious wine. Drink now. 7,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hunter Valley Show Reserve
note: 4,600 cases made.

name: Conundrum California
note: Fruity, spicy and complex with tiers of spicy Muscat flavors that blend in nicely with the toasty pear, mineral, nutmeg, peach and more. Hard to imagine a wine with more variety of flavor. Rich and smooth, with a long finish. 6,275 cases made.

name: Margaux
note: A fine value for a premium Bordeaux. Very flavorful, firm and fruity, with concentrated cassis, herb, cherry and tobacco flavors accented with cedar and cinnamon notes from oak aging. Very elegant and delicious; drink now through 1996. 5,500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Campogiovanni
note: Lean, firm and bursting with fruit. Has strong raspberry, cherry, plum and anise flavors, and hints of vanilla and spice on the finish. Beautifully balanced, with elegance, charm and impressive length. Almost drinkable now, but best after 1995. 500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
note: One of the best Sauvignon Blancs available, and at a good price. Intense and flavorful, with creamy pear, vanilla, spice and honeyed nutmeg notes and a soft finish. A complex, ripe and smooth wine that drinks easy now to 1993. 4,500 cases made.

name: Brut Sonoma County Green Valley L.D. Vrais Amis
note: A classy, complex sparkling wine. Bracing and crisp, but backed by lovely green apple and spice flavors that are shaded by doughy, toasty notes. Has good length on the finish, too. 700 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba
note: Beautifully articulated raspberry and cherry aromas and flavors are carried on a crisp background of lively acidity, rounded out with a hint of vanilla and cedar on the nose and finish, along with a lovely echo of blackberry. Tempting to drink now, but has plenty of room to grow. Drink after 1992 or '93. 350 cases made.

name: Syrah California EXP
note: Ripe, rich and opulent, with a luscious concentration of black cherry, plum and strawberry aromas and flavors and hints of pepper and smoke on the long finish. A dense, profound wine that's round in texture. Best after 1994. 835 cases made.

name: Tierra de Barros Gran Reserva
note: Distinctive, rich, mature and elegant, with plenty of spicy brown-sugar charm around a core of strawberry and raspberry flavors. Hints at leather at first, but echoes fruit on the finish. Refined and elegant. 3,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Carneros St. Clair Vineyard
note: Very firm and concentrated, with nicely modulated plum, cherry and currant aromas and flavors and sufficient tannins to hold the wine without getting in the way. Concentrated enough to develop well. Drink now through 1995. 2,588 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Estate Reserve
note: Rich and supple, it's nicely shaded by oak aging, with velvety tannins and warm currant, chocolate, anise, cherry and nutmeg flavors. The fruit and spice linger nicely on the finish. Well balanced, with firm acidity and gentle tannins. Drink now. 1,371 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Poggio all'Oro Riserva
note: Has all the ripeness, richness and complexity one could ask for in a beautifully modulated, elegant package. The aromas and flavors run toward plum, spice, coffee and anise, turning toward prune on the finish. Maintains its elegance through the long, com 1,200 cases made.

name: Blanc de Blancs Mendocino County
note: Delicate, dry and creamy, with plenty of flavor to go along with the finesse. Lemon, vanilla and fig aromas and flavors are harmoniously balanced and shaded by just enough hazelnut to keep it interesting. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: Defines purity and intensity. Shows unbelievable concentration of fruit, with amazing blackberry, cassis, dark chocolate and vanilla flavors and a great tannin structure. A breathtaking wine. Best after 1998. 20,000 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: Superbly made, giving the essence of Cabernet Sauvignon. Lots of cassis and earth aromas and flavors, spiced with excellent new wood; there is a classic backbone of well-integrated tannins. Best after 1999. 8,700 cases made.

name: Margaux
note: A great Bordeaux that needs only time to develop. Seductive, with a superb concentration of vanilla, spice, blackberry and cherry aromas and flavors. Has an iron backbone of tannins, but it still shows class and finesse. Seems to last forever on the palate. Best after 1999. 25,000 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: One of the stars in every vintage. The exciting 1989 Mouton defines class and concentration, with thick, chewy cassis, mint and berry flavors, full, silky tannins and great harmony. Best after 2000. 25,000 cases made.

name: Musigny Cuvée Vieilles Vignes
note: A benchmark wine for Burgundy. Defines harmony and class, with layer upon layer of ripe earth and raspberry flavors and a great deal of refined new oak. Has a deep, complex, velvety finish. Best from 1998 through 2000. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
note: Magnificently rich, concentrated and deep. An elegant wine that serves up ripe plum, cherry and currant flavors with spice, toast, vanilla and cedar aromas. Inspiring and as good as any from Washington. Best from 1996 through 2002. 1,033 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
note: A stylish wine, with power and grace in equal portions, offering generous currant, toast and plum flavors shaded by hints of pepper and gaminess. Beautifully balanced from start to finish, with dark cherry flavor holding on through the aftertaste. Drinkable now. A great value. 24,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Rufina
note: Amazingly concentrated for a simple Chianti, this is overflowing with wild raspberry and smoke characteristics and shows a wonderful, smooth texture. Gorgeous. Drinkable now.

name: Pauillac
note: A wine with great mass; this is a complete fruit bomb, showing blueberry, cassis and mint flavors and tons of silky tannins. Truly amazing; better than the superb '85. Best after 1998. 35,000 cases made.

name: Charmes-Chambertin
note: Opulent and sensational, with ripe fruit flavors that ooze from the glass. Not only does it have amazing fruit, but the tannins are equally impressive and are in near-perfect balance. Drink in 1998.

name: Pomerol
note: A Rolls-Royce of a wine. Explosive and opulent; perhaps as great as the '61. Big and powerful, with super-rich berry, tobacco and olive flavors and full, round, ripe tannins. Will go on for decades. Best after 1999.

name: Pomerol
note: Rich, warm, smooth and polished, with pretty, ripe, focused currant, herb, spice and oak flavors that are concentrated and deep. This gorgeous wine is packed with elegant flavors and has a long, complex aftertaste. Best from 1997 through 2001. 1,850 cases made.

name: Pomerol
note: Stellar in quality, with great concentration but also great finesse. Exuberant blackberry and tobacco aromas with hints of cedar lead to masses of fruit on the palate and full, silky tannins. One for the next century. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: We underrated Latour when tasted from the barrel. Gorgeous, with a captivating mixture of ripe berry and tobacco flavors and new wood notes. Has excellent concentration and a balance of fine tannins. Best after 1998. 17,000 cases made.

name: Pessac-Léognan
note: Big and meaty, with lots of fruit and full tannins, but featuring a sweetness and silkiness on the finish. A wine for aging. Best after 1998. 12,000 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie La Landonne
note: A dramatic, classic wine, with a rough, youthful edge. Combines deep, rich, penetrating fruit nuances that echo classic Côte-Rôtie roasted flavors of currant, plum and earthy, leathery notes enhanced by spice and pepper. The tannins are firm and tight. C 700 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Sorì San Lorenzo
note: A great wine from Barbaresco's best producer. Deep, concentrated and powerful, with bare-knuckle tannins that stand up to the ripe, rich, earthy currant, chocolate, vanilla and raspberry flavors. Dense and complex, a real mouthful of wine, with a fantastic finish. Will need until 2000 at the earliest. 877 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
note: A rising star of the region. Classically well made and sophisticated, with impressive blackberry, mint and chocolate aromas and flavors and very firm tannins on the finish. Almost like a Médoc in structure. Best after 1997. 8,000 cases made.

name: St.-Julien
note: Like the '88, this is superbly crafted, with berry, licorice and cassis aromas and flavors and a huge alcohol and tannin structure, but it's not overpowering. Shows great balance. Best after 1998. 20,000 cases made.

name: Pessac-Léognan
note: A big Bordeaux, with great presence on the palate and a stylish character of black pepper, raisin, earth, game and fruit flavors. Has a full tannin structure, but it's ripe and firm. Best after 1998. 7,500 cases made.

name: Recioto di Soave I Capitelli
note: Fasten your seat belts, because this wine takes you for an exciting ride. Packed with apricot, honey and pear flavors and tobacco and cedar notes, it's smooth, subtle and velvety. Drink now through 1996. 400 cases made.

name: Moulis
note: Luscious, with all the gorgeous raspberry and berry flavors you could want. Shows lovely, rich, ripe fruit. Perhaps the best ever at this underrated property. A superb value. Best after 1996. 25,000 cases made.

name: Pommard Les Boucherottes
note: Ripe but focused, this has a massive structure yet manages to remain elegant. A wine to put away for decades. From an exclusive vineyard owned only by Coste-Caumartin. Drinkable 1997 to 2000. 650 cases made.

name: St.-Julien
note: One of the best ever produced from this estate. Intense ripe cherry aromas and flavors come through in this St.-Julien that's big and alcholic, with full silky tannins. Built more like Port than wine. Best after 1998. 25,000 cases made.

name: St.-Estèphe
note: What a surprise. Big and powerful, but very elegant at the same time, with lots of spice, juniper, vanilla and berry flavors and a super tannin structure. Best after 1998. 21,000 cases made.

name: St.-Estèphe
note: A beast that's reverting to its old style. Giant in structure, ripping your palate apart with jammy tar and plump, overripe fruit flavors and masses of tannins. One of the most concentrated Bordeaux we have tasted in recent memory. Really needs time. Best after 1997. 22,000 cases made.

name: Cardinale Meritage California
note: Rich, ripe and concentrated, bursting with plum, blueberry and currant aromas and flavors laced with spicy, chocolaty oak that echoes vanilla and cinnamon on the long finish. Keeps pumping out the flavor for minutes on end. A really classy mouthful; should develop and soften. Best from 1997 through 2000. 1,900 cases made.

name: Hermitage La Chapelle
note: Bold, ripe and powerful, with a solid, rich core of mineral, currant, plum and cedar flavors that are remarkably complex, smooth and polished, with fine but firm tannins. Elegant, refined and tasty to drink now, but sure to age. 9,400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Martha's Vineyard
note: Deep, dense, dark and dangerous, this is a powerful wine, with distinctive flavors of currant, mint, eucalyptus and more, cascading and deepening with each sip. Turns gamy and chocolaty on the finish, suggesting this will be a polished, elegant wine by the time it reaches it peak. Best after 1997. 4,740 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Rosacker
note: Offers great depth and complexity. Has enticing coconut, honey, apple and spice aromas. Medium-bodied and dry, with super-ripe apple and coconut flavors and an intensely rich finish. Drinkable now.

name: Pauillac
note: Hard as a rock right now. This is tough, with tons of tannins holding down whatever is underneath, which appears to be rich fruit. Needs time; try after 1998. 18,000 cases made.

name: St.-Julien
note: Has an extremely impressive, velvety mouth-feel, with rich chocolate, berry and cedar aromas and flavors and a long, almost sweet finish. Try after 1997. 7,000 cases made.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée Réserve
note: An excellent Tokay Pinot Gris; like a great white Burgundy. Rich, yet delicate and refined. Full-bodied and dry, with vanilla ice cream and fruit aromas. Overflowing with tropical fruit, vanilla, almond and cream flavors and a smoky finish that goes on and on. Drinkable now.

name: Rioja Reserva
note: Enticing aromas of black coffee and dark chocolate lead to a full-bodied, well-integrated palate that's rich with ripe plum flavor and silky tannins. A benchmark for the vintage.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
note: Just delicious; a lovely layering of currant, berry, vanilla and cocoa butter aromas and flavors, all resting on a silky texture that spins out the flavors on a long finish. A seductive wine to drink now through 1996. 501 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Estate Reserve
note: Seductive, ripe, round and generous, with a nice tension between the plump core of plum, black cherry and currant flavors and the lavish overlay of spicy, toasty oak notes. It's all smoothly integrated with soft tannins and offers plenty of flavor on the finish. Best after 1996. 3,015 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard Sand Hill
note: Rich, dense and young, with toasty, buttery notes over tight fruit flavors that will need a few years to develop fully. Creamy, peachy, pearlike and intense, but still a bit raw from oak; drinkable now. 2,470 cases made.

name: Pommard Premier Cru
note: For being a blend of vineyards, this is unbelievable. Ripe, rich and firm, showing terrific breeding, with lovely, elegant, focused red berry flavors and superfine tannins. Drinkable now.

name: Chassagne-Montrachet Les Grandes Ruchottes
note: Rich, creamy and concentrated around a racy core of zingy, lemony acidity, packing in ripe pear, peach and honey aromas and flavors and hinting at hazelnut on the long finish. Jams in so much flavor it needs at least until 1997 to sort everything out, although it should be delicious anytime. 55 cases made.

name: Volnay Caillerets Ancienne Cuvée Carnot
note: Has a fantastic concoction of rich, focused Pinot Noir flavors that takes on a racy edge. Ultra-fine tannins, smooth-textured and polished but the fruit is deep, complex and persistent. An outstanding wine from a highly-rated year. Should get even better if aged. Best after 1995. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Special Selection
note: Not quite the glorious wine of previous vintages, but has layer after layer of flavors, with plum, prune and black cherry and hints of spicy vanilla and chocolate. Shows remarkable clarity and a supple texture that should get silkier and smoother with age. Drinkable now, but should improve through 1997 to 2000. 1,000 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Cuvée Dom Pérignon
note: Has oodles of Champagne complexity in a creamy, smooth package. Rich, toasty, creamy and elegant, with delicious nutty flavors that linger on the finish. Enormously concentrated; shows the full benefit of long-term aging on the yeast.

name: Bâtard-Montrachet
note: Rich, ripe and redolent of butterscotch and pear, showing plenty of breadth and depth plus enough restraint to qualify as as elegant. Drink now. 75 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Beautifully crafted, elegantly balanced and remarkably focused and flavorful, with a brilliant beam of spicy currant, plum and blackberry flavors, smoothly integrated tannins and sneaky acidity that keeps the flavors coming on the long finish. Best after 1995. 2,209 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley Dickerson
note: A delicious young Zin that is ripe, rich tannic and tasty, with tiers of fresh berry, raspberry and cherry flavors that zoom across the palate. Fresh and lively. A mouth-watering wine that drinks well now, but can hold. Drink now through 1997. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Berardenga Riserva
note: Another winner from this estate. Made in a New World style, with lots of new wood, showing toasted coconut, milk chocolate and fruit aromas and flavors. Round and velvety, with lots of cedar notes on the finish. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico Poggio Rosso Riserva
note: A wine in near perfect harmony and balance. Deeply colored, with lovely berry, violet and fruit aromas and flavors and a soft, caressing finish. A superb wine that's wonderful to drink now or hold.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
note: Intensely rich and fruity, with smoky, buttery oak shadings that add complexity and depth to the ripe pear, spice and apple flavors. Sharply focused, long and lingering on the finish. A real beauty. Drink now through 1994. 2,900 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
note: Bold, rich and fruity, with ripe, concentrated plum, currant and raspberry flavors that run deep. Has subtle oak shadings on the finish and well-integrated tannins that are present but not overbearing. Beautifully crafted but needs until 1995. 800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Columbia Valley
note: A real zinger, combining great value and outstanding quality. Crisp and lively, with a creamy richness that lifts it out of the ordinary. Citrus, floral and pear aromas and flavors slip in and out of the spotlight, and it remains refreshing through the long finish. Drink now. 11,700 cases made.

name: Rioja Conde de Valdemar Reserva
note: Very appealing, perfumed and pretty, with bright, exuberant blackberry and boysenberry flavors on a bed of violets and vanilla. Has good concentration. Drink now.

name: Pessac-Léognan
note: The fruit jumps out of the glass, with masses of cassis, berry and earth aromas and flavors and a bounty of velvety tannins to back them up. Try after 1997. 15,000 cases made.

name: St.-Estèphe
note: This beautifully balanced Bordeaux has rich berry, plum and spice flavors and silky tannins on the finish. Try after 1996. 25,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Réserve Spéciale
note: Starts slow, with tightly wound pear, vanilla and spice flavors, but gains velocity and depth, picking up pretty nutmeg and spice flavors on the finish. A well-crafted wine that shows richness, depth and complexity. Tight and youthful; drinkable now, or cellar through 1995. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Barrel Fermented
note: Smooth, ripe and generous, with rich, complex, polished pear, spice, hazelnut and honey notes. The fruit zooms across the palate. A stylish wine that's delicious; drinkable now. 6,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
note: Bold, ripe and intense, with layers of plum, cedar, spice, anise and currant flavors that are rich, deep and concentrated. Has firm but polished tannins and a long, lingering aftertaste that keeps repeating the fruit themes. 1,600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Reserve
note: Powerful and complete, with depth, complexity and great balance. The black cherry and currant flavors are focused, and a kiss of sweet oak lasts through the long finish. For all its flavor, it remains light on its feet. Drinkable now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Vintage Selection
note: Rich and lively, with ripe black cherry, pepper, currant and spice flavors that are complex and concentrated, almost opulent. Is at a nice phase, but the tannins are still firm and compact. Finishes with pretty fruit flavors. Drink after 1995. 2,950 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Reserve
note: Deep, dark and complex, with a pretty, concentrated core of currant, cherry, spice and oak flavors. Crisp and lively, finishing with a delicate aftertaste that echoes fruit and oak. Has wonderful balance and depth. Drink now. 154 cases made.

name: Rioja Gran Reserva
note: A gorgeous wine, brimming with plum, cedar and licorice flavors and young, fresh fruit braced by firm, spicy tannins. Perfectly proportioned, with plenty of time ahead. Drinkable now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Artist Series
note: Lean, tight, firm, rich and deeply flavored, packed with spicy currant, plum and cherry flavors framed by spicy, buttery oak notes. While it's firmly tannic now, there's a smoothness to the texture that's a good sign, but it's much too young to drink now 2,700 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Turckheim Brand
note: An electrifying wine, with super-charged flavors. Smooth and superb, with great acidity and ripe fruit flavors. Drink now.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Jubilée Réserve Personnelle
note: An exotic style of wine, with the power of a top white Burgundy. Concentrated aromas of tangerine and coconut; full-bodied and dry, with super-rich fruit flavors and a long, balanced finish of acidity. Very harmonious. Drink now.

name: Rioja White Reserva
note: Maturing, but still monumental, this is rich with honey, vanilla, pear and melon flavors and still has a long life ahead of it.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Napa Valley Edelwein Gold
note: One of the most collectible sweet wines from California. Ripe, buttery, rich and sweet, with all kinds of spice, honey and butter notes gracing the core of sweet pineapple, fig and pear flavors. Tempting to drink now, but could improve through 1996. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
note: Pulls out all the stops. Ripe, buttery aromas and rich butterscotch flavors add up to a lush, soft wine that makes a bold style statement. Honey and peach notes lie beneath the overlay of oak aging.

name: Bordeaux White
note: A new white wine from the famous Pauillac estate. Flavorful, soft and generous, with herbal, earthy aromas turning toward spice and vanilla on the palate. Plush and strongly oak-accented, with solid pear and cream flavors at the center. Drink now. 2,400 cases made.

name: Vosne-Romanée
note: Displays stunning balance in a village wine, with alluring violet, berry and chocolate flavors, fine tannins and a long, delicious finish. Drinkable now.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles Westside
note: Ripe and bold, with generous blackberry, plum and slightly pruny, spicy aromas and flavors that seem to jump out of the glass. Supple and bursting with character. Drink now through 1996. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Berardenga
note: A blockbuster, with masses of plum, tar and berry aromas and flavors. Coats your palate with fruit and tannins. Drink now.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Saunders Vineyard
note: Ripe and inviting, a firm-backboned, creamy-textured, oak-scented masterpiece, offering opulent raspberry, cherry, vanilla and spice flavors and nice hints of pepper and butter on the long finish. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma County
note: A beautifully harmonious wine, with intense fruit flavors that blend seamlessly with accents of spicy oak. Velvety in texture, moderately tannic and long on the finish. The cherry and plum flavors have finesse. Drinkable now but should continue to develop through 1997. 400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Premiere Vineyard
note: Lots of flavor and a delicate texture add up to a wine with finesse and elegance. Floral, pear and hazelnut aromas and flavors are immediately attractive, with richness to burn. Spicy fruit notes emerge on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Puente Alto Vineyard Don Melchor Private Reserve
note: Powerful and intense, pouring on the spice, with smoke, tobacco and cedar aromas backed by rich, ripe plum, prune and pepper flavors. A real mouthful, graced with chocolate and spice notes. Full-bodied and long on the finish. Perhaps Chile's best red wine. Drink now through 1995. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Triere Vineyard
note: A very exotic wine that emphasizes the nutmeg and vanilla flavors of oak aging and backs it up with buttery pear accents. Soft and delicate in texture, but full in flavor, with complexities that develop on the finish. 16,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
note: Full, rich and generous, with complex currant, chocolate and herb aromas and flavors shaded by sweet oak. A lively wine, with deep flavors and pretty spice notes on the finish. The tannins are present but not intrusive. Drinkable now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Australia Eileen Hardy
note: A ripe, buttery wine that's deeply colored and deeply flavorful. The solid core of pineapple and pear flavor is shaded by hints of nutmeg, caramel and vanilla notes. A broad style that already shows finesse. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
note: Firm, focused and flavorful, offering distinctive spice and mint-tinged Cabernet characteristics, lots of currant and plum flavors and more richness, depth and concentration than most '89s. Oak seasoning adds a nice dimension, and the tannins are sufficient to warrant cellaring through 1995 to '98. 23,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Northern Sonoma Alexander's Crown Vineyard
note: Smooth and generous, with layers of ripe currant, blackberry and buttery oak flavors. Finishes with a sense of polish and elegance. Almost drinkable now, and has the intensity to improve through 1997 to 2000. 6,000 cases made.

name: Sémillon Chalk Hill Late Harvest
note: Would give most Sauternes a run for their money. The salty, nutty, tobaccolike aromas and rich, ripe flavors are full and satisfying. Sweet, unctuous and long on the finish. Mature now and ready to drink. 2,262 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River
note: Crisp and focused, with sharply defined peach, pear and spice aromas and flavors, hinting at toast and butter on the long finish. The structure is tight, suggesting this will improve with cellaring. Drink now through 1995. 21,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Barrel Selected Private Reserve
note: Crisp at the center, but nicely rounded and polished around the edges, featuring toasty hazelnut, pear and honey aromas and flavors that extend into a long finish. Reminiscent of a good Puligny-Montrachet. Has style and grace. 700 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Pesquera Crianza
note: Firm and fleshy, with generous currant, berry and plum flavors shaded by toasty oak and a nice streak of earthy gaminess that gives it a unique and appealing character. Has style and intensity, plus enough tannin to wait until 1996 to '99 in the cellar. 15,000 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba Conca Tre Pile
note: Tart, flavorful and spicy, with a generous, focused beam of juicy berry and currant flavors and a touch of oak on the finish, ending up smooth and balanced. Drinkable now.

name: Cabernet Breganze Fratta
note: Rich, balanced and deep, with great harmony. At this stage you taste a lot of new oak, but the generous vanilla, violet and toast notes complement the rich plum and black currant flavors. Best after 1995.

name: Chablis Les Preuses
note: Bold and intense, with rich, lively pear, peach, honey and citrus flavors that are fresh and lively. Complex and concentrated, showing a burst of fruit on the finish. Drinkable now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Keyneton Hill of Grace
note: One of Australia's finest red wines. Extremely ripe in flavor and plush in texture, with a great combination of fruit, spice, chocolate and tobacco. Complex, intense and satisfying, showing enough oak. Resembles a Côte-Rôtie. Tempting to drink now, but s 2,000 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Selezione del Trentennio '30'
note: Intense and concentrated, with sharply focused cherry, raspberry, anise and rose petal flavors that are deep and complex. The tannins and acidity taste raw. Very tightly wound. Cellar until 1999 for best results. 2,000 cases made.

name: Hermitage Monier de la Sizeranne
note: Ripe, rich and complex, with deep currant, earth, oak and spice flavors that are finely woven together. The tannins are firm and rugged and clamp down on the finish. Best after 1997. 8,500 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Brut Premier
note: Creamy, elegant and stylish, offering complex layers of pear, spice, honey and vanilla flavors that are smooth and polished, finishing with a long, complex aftertaste. Subtle and refined; a treat to drink.

name: Meursault
note: Crisp and clean, with sharply focused pear, citrus, hazelnut and apple flavors that turn smooth, complex and creamy on the finish. Has delicacy and character. Drinkable now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel El Dorado Walker Vineyard
note: Round and ripe, with a fine line of sweet currant and plum aromas and flavors running through it from the first sip to the long finish. Beautifully crafted fruit flavors are immediately appealing, and the texture is plush and smooth. A real winner. Taste 750 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer California
note: An intensely flavorful, full-bodied, Alsatian-style wine, with layers of heady fruit, spice and mineral flavors that linger on the long finish. Dry in sugar, but rich in fruit and body, this is smooth in texture and very distinctive. 1,600 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
note: A classy, finely crafted wine, offering lovely raspberry, berry and leaf aromas and flavors and a long, silky finish. Drink now. From Farina Stefano. 25,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
note: Extremely focused, with multidimensional fruit and earth aromas and flavors and a lovely, silky mouth-feel. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Fumé Blanc Napa Valley
note: A very concentrated, classic Sauvignon Blanc, with intense, crisp fruit and herb flavors that linger a long time on the finish. Has great balance and depth. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Fumé Blanc Barrell-Fermented Reserve Alexander Valley
note: Stands out from the pack. A rich-tasting, rich-textured Fumé Blanc, with butter and vanilla overtones to the citrus and pear flavors. Has depth, elegance and a long finish. 24,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
note: Firm and focused, with a nice balance of ripe plum, currant and berry flavors against spicy, toasty notes on the long, concentrated finish. Has the intensity and harmony to develop nicely through 1995 to '97. Reasonably priced, too. 11,000 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape La Bernardine
note: Shows uncommon balance, proportion and finesse, offering lovely currant, cherry, chocolate and smoky oak flavors that are complex and luscious. The finish is long and complex, with soft but firm tannins. Tasty now, but can age through 1998. 8,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County
note: Complex and intriguing for its band of flavors, offering lots of smoky raspberry, cherry, earth and tar notes that give dimension to the cola and oak shadings. Intense and lively, yet smooth in texture, finishing with a rich core of fruit flavor and a decadent edge that adds to the wine's interest. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: Like a Michelangelo; everything is in perfect proportion. Has an amazing amount of violets, new wood and fruit on the nose and palate and a superb concentration of silky tannins. The wine of the vintage, and the best from this estate since the legendary 1961. Best after 2000.

name: Barolo Sperss
note: Complex and fascinating, offering all sorts of floral, earthy overtones to the solid core of black cherry, blackberry and anise flavors. An intense wine that shows many facets, including a welcome whiff of vanilla and toast on the aftertaste. 2,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Limited Reserve
note: A beautifully crafted Cabernet that combines ripe, rich, complex currant, black cherry, cedar, vanilla bean and spice. Wonderful depth, beautifully articulated flavors that keep pumping out the flavors. Delicious now, but should hold and gain through the decade. Best after 1996. 2,994 cases made.

name: Pessac-Léognan
note: Seductively powerful, with tons of lovely oak and ripe fruit flavors, full tannins and a long, luscious finish. Drinkable in 1998. 20,000 cases made.

name: Corton-Charlemagne
note: A throughbred of a wine that takes off on the finish. Superb. Wonderful aromas and flavors of coconut, lemon and pineapple. Full bodied yet balanced. Drink after 1997. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: This seductive, exciting Bordeaux has pulled all together since our barrel tasting. Harmonious and silky in texture, with mint, berry and cassis aromas and flavors and ultrafine tannins. It's hard not to drink it now, but try to wait. Best after 1998. 33,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Opulent and chewy with lots of ripe fruit flavors and spicy, buttery oak shadings. Serves up a rich core of black cherry, currant and plum-tinged fruit and finishes with a delicious encore of fruit and oak. Wonderful depth, richness, balance and finesse. 2,400 cases made.

name: Ornellaia
note: This is a blockbuster with masses of chocolate, earth, minty aromas and flavors; full bodied with full round tannins and a super acid backbone. Best Ornellaia ever made. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. 8,330 cases made.

name: St.-Julien
note: Sculpted like a Rodin, this is a rugged yet well-defined Bordeaux that offers one of the best values of this outstanding vintage. Shows concentrated cassis, berry and dark chocolate flavors, rich tannins and a long, opulent finish. Best after 1998. 20,000 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: The great first-growth estate produced a wine with amazing length in this new vintage. Goes on and on, with mint, plum and cassis aromas and flavors and ultrafine tannins. A superb Bordeaux. Best after 1999. 25,000 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Sorì San Lorenzo
note: Tough in texture, but ripe and toasty, offering lovely black cherry, plum and violet aromas and flavors, remaining generous and flavorful through the firm and elegant finish. Needs time to sort out the tannins, but everything is beautifully integrated and harmonious. Best after 1997. 900 cases made.

name: Pomerol
note: An absolutely massive Bordeaux, with tons of exotic, ripe raspberry flavor and velvety tannins. Thick and rich, yet has great balance. A fine candidate for cellaring. Best after 2000. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
note: Smooth, rich and opulent, exotically spicy, deep and concentrated. Lays out plum, prune, nutmeg, cedar and black cherry flavors with almost digital definition, echoing licorice on the finish. Fabulous, supple and delicious now. Best from 1995 through 2002. 915 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie La Turque
note: Ripe and chunky, a demonically concentrated wine, its cherry, mineral, toast and violet flavors richeting around the palate, an exuberant, profound wine that needs until 1997 or 1998 just to settle down; should be at its best after 2000. 700 cases made.

name: Pomerol
note: An aristocratic wine that's almost as good as the awesome '89. Expressive and sophisticated, with wonderful ripe fruit and vanilla aromas, a palate of extremely silky tannins and superb flavor concentration. Best after 1999. 3,700 cases made.

name: Pomerol
note: The Charles Atlas of Pomerol, with great muscular tannins. Amazingly ripe, offering intense oak, chocolate and fruit aromas and flavors. Best after 1998. 2,300 cases made.

name: Barolo Cannubi Ca' dei Gancia
note: This stunning wine is rippling with layers and layers of dense, exuberant black cherry, violet, blackberry, tar and vanilla aromas and flavors. Muscular at the core, but sweet and supple through the extraordinary finish. A great wine in any context. The tannins are so refined you could drink it now, but has the stuff to age past 2000. 825 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Alexander Valley Late Harvest Special Select
note: Deep, dark, ripe and rich, a gorgeous, unctuous wine that offers cascades of honey, floral, caramel, apricot, pear and ginger aromas and flavors, finishing almost delicate for such a rich wine. Fabulous to drink now, perhaps best in 1996-1998. 475 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: This big, up-front Bordeaux offers intense cedar, tobacco, cassis and berry aromas that carry through on the palate and lots of tannins to back it all up. As big as the great '82. Best after 1998. 27,500 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
note: Combines power and elegance, showing the rich structure of a long-aging wine, yet the complexity is already elegant, with ripe fruit, cedar, licorice, violet, plum and mineral aromas and flavors. Best after 2000. 8,500 cases made.

name: Pomerol
note: Dense and powerful, with a breathtaking aftertaste of blackberries, chocolate and earth flavors. A superb wine; the harmonious structure will easily take it into the next century. Best after 2000. 2,600 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: A deep, dark giant, with smoky cassis aromas and flavors and tons of fruit and tannins. Isn't giving much now, but it's all there. Best after 2000. 900 cases made.

name: Barolo Bric dël Fiasc
note: A luscious mouthful of wild berries, black cherry, toast and rose petal. Concentrated and exotic, a powerful wine with totally disarming aromas and flavors and remarkably supple texture. Layers and layers of personality make this a stellar candidate for cellaring. Best after 1997. 800 cases made.

name: Barolo Cannubi Boschis
note: A mind-bending wine—deep, dark, dense and concentrated. A powerful wine with generous raspberry and cherry flavors, ample tannins that is smoothly integrated. Gorgeous rose- and tar-scented flavors carry through the finish. 680 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
note: Dances across your palate with floral, vanilla, blackberry and black cherry flavors and superbly silky tannins. An exciting wine. Drink after 1998. 8,000 cases made.

name: St.-Estèphe
note: A textbook wine for the appellation, with spicy, meaty characteristics, full tannins and a long, juicy finish. Don't touch this for a decade. Drink after 2000. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pomerol
note: Solid and racy, with complex tar, licorice, violet and ripe fruit aromas that echo in the flavors. Shows excellent tannin structure. Drink after 1998. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pomerol
note: As usual, this is big, thick and rich, showing loads of nutmeg, berry and ripe fruit characteristics. Long on the finish, with extremely velvety tannins. Has put on weight since our first barrel tasting. Drink after 1998. 6,000 cases made.

name: Sangioveto
note: The greatest Sangioveto ever made. Massive wine with layers of tobacco, chocolate and violet character; full bodied and complete with perfect tannin structure and excellent acid. Best after 1997. 500 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: A seamless wine with great character, offering cigar, tobacco, cedar, and rich plum flavors. Full-bodied yet well balanced, with lovely, full, silky tannins and a long finish. Best after 2000. 13,000 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Marcarini
note: Sensational expression of Nebbiolo, exploding with black cherry, wild berry, lemon verbena and anise flavors without an overlay of oak, an exotic wine that holds itself in check just enough to qualify as elegant. Fresh and vibrant, tempting to drink now, but probably best from 1996. 600 cases made.

name: Barolo La Corda della Briccolina
note: Totally disarming, a gorgeous array of rose petal and anise-scented raspberry, vanilla and strawberry aromas and flavors extending through a supple finish that wraps its fine tannins smoothly around the warm fruit and spice. Drink now. 725 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
note: Wild and exciting, a classy wine with a round, polished texture and intense smoke, vanilla and grape aromas and flavors. This property is really coming on strong. Best after 1997. 3,000 cases made.

name: Montrachet
note: Packed to the brim with coconut, butterscotch, apple and pineapple character. Full-bodied, with amazing acidity and class.  Try now. 600 cases made.

name: Meursault Désirée
note: Fantastic, with intense aromas of white truffles, apples and fruit. Full-bodied and concentrated, with great acidity. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Bâtard-Montrachet
note: A wine with laser-guided flavors. Intense pear, lemon, vanilla and coconut character. Great backbone and superb, fresh finish. Best after 1996. 700 cases made.

name: St.-Estèphe
note: Overflowing with berry and raspberry flavors, this is elegant and fine in structure, with firm tannins and excellent length. Drink after 1998. 14,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Young, firm and intense, with a rich, complex, concentrated core of currant, cherry, anise and toasty, buttery oak flavors. A wine of great harmony, finesse, elegance and grace. Well-articulated fruit flavors stay focused on the long, rich finish. Delicious now, with its silky tannins, but should age well through the decade. Perhaps best around 1997. 3,646 cases made.

name: St.-Estèphe
note: This monstrous wine shows huge amounts of cherry and toasted oak flavors and velvety tannins. Quite hard on the palate, but the very long finish suggests greatness. From Jean-Michel Cazes. Drink after 1998. 12,500 cases made.

name: Pessac-Léognan
note: A superbly crafted wine, with lush, velvety tannins and gorgeous plum, earth and vanilla flavors. This estate is on the rise. Try in 1998. 13,000 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
note: Big and chunky, offering loads of strawberry, earth, toasted oak and mint aromas and flavors. Has superb, velvety tannins and a long finish. Drink after 1997. 4,500 cases made.

name: Barolo
note: Ripe, round and utterly distinctive, a rich-textured, refined wine with layers of spice, black cherry, black raspberry and cola winding through very fine, smooth-textured tannins, echoing coffee and violets along with the fruit. So supple that it's drinkable now, but best after 1996. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
note: Smooth, ripe and exotic. This fat, opulent wine displays spectacular blackberry, black cherry, currant and plum aromas and flavors that all come together in a silky, supple package. Delicious now, but should keep growing through 1998. 531 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
note: Wonderful richness, depth and complexity, jam-packed with flavor, with tiers of pear, spice, apple and pineapple framed by smoky, toasty oak nuances that fold together into a tight, youthful and vibrant wine. Delicious now, but a good bet to gain through 1996. 400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey
note: Ripe, intense and concentrated, with rich, spicy pear, peach and pineapple flavors that are smooth and polished. Reveals more depth and finesse with each sip and gains complexity and grace on the long, smoky finish. Simply delicious to drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
note: Powerful and exotic, displaying full-blown tropical fruit flavors and a spicy character. This full-bodied wine towers over most others in this category with its sheer intensity. Drinkable now. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Deep, dense and delicious, bursting with plum, currant, chocolate and spice aromas and flavors, generous and concentrated, an elegant wine with power. Echoes anise and fruit on the long finish. Has enough tannin to want until 1998-2000. 2,000 cases made.

name: St.-Julien
note: Sleek and racy, with plum, raspberry and earth aromas and flavors, silky tannins and a wonderfully long finish. Drink after 1998. 22,000 cases made.

name: St.-Julien
note: Like eating a reduced raspberry sauce. Rich and thick, with tons of fruit and velvety tannins, yet it's perfectly balanced. Drink now through 2003. 25,000 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne La Grande Dame
note: Like a wild horse. Tons of potential. It's extremely exuberant and lively. Full bodied with masses of lemon, toast and apple character. It shows great acidity and long finish.

name: Pessac-Léognan White
note: A stunning wine. Wonderfully deep, rich and complex, with tiers of honey, pear, spice and pineapple flavors, a silky-smooth texture and a finish that keeps pumping out the flavors. A wine with presence. Ready now through 1996. Definitely improved since o 750 cases made.

name: Echézeaux
note: Smooth, polished and velvety, a richly layered wine with marvelous plum, blackberry, vanilla, toast and spice aromas and flavors that linger on the finish. Graceful and deep. Perhaps best around 2000 to 2005. 1,446 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County
note: Packs in lots of flavor, with ripe, spicy honey, pear, citrus and buttery oak nuances that turn rich and smooth on the palate. Has depth and complexity, echoing honey and spice on the long finish. Delicious now. 11,759 cases made.

name: Muscat Canelli Monterey Vin de Glacière
note: Brilliantly spicy, fruity and generous, showing its flavors with digital clarity—nutmeg, cinnamon, pear, apple and honey—finishing sweet, rich and amazingly balanced. Drinkable now. 3,200 cases made.

name: Syrah McLaren Vale Show Reserve
note: Deep, dense, dark and powerful, with layers and layers of plum, berry, chocolate, coffee and cedar flavors finishing round and generous. Drink now. 1,900 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Nackenheim Rothenberg
note: This electrifying wine jolts you with its intense flavors. Starts with citrus, apricot and lemon notes and ends with honey, floral and almond flavors on the clean, focused, complex finish. Drinkable now, but should be better after 1997. 350 cases made.

name: Conundrum California
note: This delicious wine pumps out lots of flavor, with pear, spice, vanilla, apple and peach all rolling together in the same direction. Elegant, impeccably balanced and long and lingering on the finish, where it turns to honey and sweet oak. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Pomerol
note: A gorgeous wine that keeps you coming back for more, offering wonderful milk chocolate, roasted oak and fruit aromas and flavors and plenty of silky tannins. Best after 1997. 3,500 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne R de Ruinart
note: Rich and earthy with complex pear, toast and honeyed flavors that taste mature, picking up carmel and earth flavors that offer uncommon depth and richness. Delicious now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Meursault Les Tessons Clos de Mon Plaisir
note: A blockbuster, with vanilla, honey, butterscotch and ripe fruit aromas and flavors. Full-bodied and immensely appealing. Best after 1996. 475 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti
note: Peppery, spicy notes invigorate this smooth-textured, nicely balanced wine, berry at the core, hinting at tobacco and tar on the rich finish. Drinkable now through 1996 and beyond. 11,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Woodburne Cuvée
note: This Washington wine has all the facets and depth you want in a barrel-fermented, malolactic-style Chardonnay.  Apple and pear flavors are spiced up by toasty, buttery aromas and a spicy, butterscotchy note on the finish.  Rich, beautifully balanced and complex. 7,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Scherrer Vineyards
note: Delicious, pure and ripe, offering cherry, raspberry, plum and spice flavors. Intense, complex, wonderfully balanced and harmonious. Try a bottle now and enjoy for its vitality, and keep a few to see what happens. Best from 1994 through 2000. 531 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
note: Ripe, lush and spicy, with a rich core of pear, peach and nectarine flavors kept alive by crisp acidity. Has a smooth, creamy texture and a long, full, lingering aftertaste. Drink now. 3,470 cases made.

name: Meritage Lake County
note: Comes alive with rich, complex fruit that echoes currant, spice and cherry, with a pretty toasty, buttery character from new oak. Balanced and concentrated, adding a long, full finish that keeps pumping out the flavor. 66 percent Cabernet Sauvignon, 18 percent Cabernet Franc, 15 percent Merlot. 4,672 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Anderson Valley Première Reserve
note: Bold, ripe, rich and creamy with pretty spice and vanilla flavors, but also a load of pear, apple, citrus and toast notes on a long, full, complex finish. Wonderful sense of harmony and finesse; drinks well now but should hold through 1995. 3,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Barrel Select
note: Youthful, tight and focused, with spicy pear, nutmeg and melon flavors and pretty oak shadings. An impeccably well-balanced wine that allows the ripe fruit to play off the toasty oak and stay together through the finish. Drinkable now, but may benefit from cellaring. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros
note: Ripe, rich and packed with flavor, with tiers of honey, pear and butterscotch. The texture is smooth and silky, and flavors run on and on, gaining nuances on the finish. Best Rombauer Chardonnay in years. Delicious now through 1995. 4,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
note: Ripe, rich and seductive with currant, black cherry, anise and plum flavors framed by toasty, buttery oak notes. Uncommon in California Merlot for its opulence and finesse; has fine tannins and a silky texture, yet also the depth to age through 1997. 15,000 cases made.

name: Sancerre La Moussière
note: Ripe, round and spicy, this uniquely balanced wine offers hazelnut, butter and toast nuances to the basic green apple and honeydew melon aromas and flavors that echo on the long finish. A stylish wine that shows all the signs of growing more complex. Drink now through 1995. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley Reserve
note: A great combination of ripeness and delicacy, with honey, hazelnut, pear and butter flavors. True Chardonnay flavor comes through in this Washington wine, with complexity and length. Beautifully balanced, showing richness without weight. Drink now through 1995. 2,060 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Lytton Springs
note: Full-blown and fully oaked, displaying a fine, deep color, rich fruit flavors and polished tannins. Lush in texture and sweet with vanilla and spice notes from oak aging, but backed by solid blackberry, currant and black cherry flavors. A concentrated California Zinfandel. Best from 1995 through 2000. 7,430 cases made.

name: Fronsac
note: A classy wine that shows great winemaking. Fills your mouth with plum and black cherry flavors and silky tannins. From Michel Rolland. Drinkable now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
note: A tight, tannic wine, with potential for aging. Already has a complex aroma, but the stiff texture and intense fruit will need time to open up for maximum enjoyment. Currant, black cherry, cedar, earth and spice flavors make it fascinating to sip. Best after 1997. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Firm and intense with a solid core of cherry, currant, plum and spice flavors that gently unfold into a spicy, concentrated, impeccably balanced wine that finishes with pretty, cedary oak notes and fine tannins. Tempting now for its plush texture, but sure to pick up complexity. Drink now through 2002. 2,400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Sleek and flavorful, this pretty, almost exotic wine has lots of fruit and spice flavors and a long finish. Mint and currant aromas, a smooth texture, supple tannins and great balance add to its appeal. Drinkable now, but so nicely proportioned that it should age through at least 1997. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
note: Ripe, smooth and polished, with rich, concentrated pear, fig, herb, spice and citrus flavors that turn creamy and complex on the long, full finish. One sip calls for another. Delicious through 1995. 11,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Barbara County
note: Firm and flavorful, with a nice array of spicy, toasty, slightly herbal pear, honey and grapefruit aromas and flavors that ride gently into a long finish. Stylish, harmonious and graceful, showing a definite touch of oak. Drinkable now. 2,803 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
note: A full-fledged Merlot, with ripe, spicy flavors, a deep color and a lingering finish. Packs in currant, plum and black cherry flavors accented by cedar, nutmeg and vanilla from oak aging, all wrapped in a supple but firm texture and fine tannins. Shows great potential. Drink from 1994 to 2000. 1,800 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Gold Leaf Cuvée
note: Crisp and lively, with a rich, focused band of raspberry, cherry and currant flavors flanked by firm, drying tannins. Packs in lots of fresh, lively fruit and is elegantly balanced. The tannins suggest you can cellar this through 1998. 2,050 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
note: Solidly built, well packed with currant, plum, toast and tobacco aromas and flavors, persisting and spreading on the finish. Gets a little tannic, but it should be terrific after 1998. 33,381 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Zeltinger Sonnenuhr
note: This has what many '92 Mosel Rieslings are lacking: structure and concentration. A bit shy now, but the peach, floral and mineral flavors become fuller and more complex after a while in the glass. Try now.

name: Meursault Clos de la Baronne Domaine René Manuel
note: Wonderfully ripe, with toasted oak, vanilla, honey and tropical fruit; a full body and a long, flavorful, fresh finish. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Meursault
note: Lovely, with lime, lemon, mineral and vanilla aromas and flavors, medium body and an intense finish. Drink now.

name: Barolo
note: Ripe and complex, a full-bodied wine with more finesse than most, offering harmonious black cherry, plum, anise and tar, along with a definite toasty spiciness. Tannins are definitely firm, but there is a real sense of freshness that should keep it developing through 1998. 7,000 cases made.

name: Barolo Brunate
note: Smooth and polished, with an elegant beam of raspberry, cherry, spice and rose petal lighting up the aromas and flavors, sweet tannins swarming over the finish. Still, the fruit shines through. Best to drink from 1997. 1,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Ynez Valley Barrel Fermented
note: A graceful, harmonious California Chardonnay, with plenty of style. Crisp, focused and flavorful, with spicy, toasty apple, pear and vanilla aromas and flavors that swirl around on the finish. Drinkable now. 16,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Knights Valley
note: Firm and ripe, a medium-weight wine with a fleshy texture and spicy, cedary currant and mineral aromas and flavors, all of it smoothly shaped into a wine that should continue to improve through 1999. 35,000 cases made.

name: Meritage Alexander Valley
note: Ripe and distinctive, with a toffee, spice-scented tone to the supple currant and blackberry flavors, finishing rich and elegant. Has the style and concentration to mature through 1998. 70 percent Cabernet Sauvignon, 25 percent Cabernet Franc and 5 percent Merlot. 8,000 cases made.

name: Puligny-Montrachet
note: Exceedingly ripe with wild fruit and earthy aromas and flavors; full bodied and intense with firm acidity. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Hermitage
note: A youthful, intense Hermitage that shows a lot of spicy oak at this stage, but concentrated black cherry and currant flavors underneath mark it as a serious candidate for the cellar. It's rare to find this much flavor, but the tannins and obvious oak not 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley 20th Anniversary
