name: Santenay Clos de Malte
note: Impressive quality for a Santenay. Clean, pure, full-bodied, with ripe blackberry and wild raspberry flavors, wonderful terroir and mineral character, this has breeding and class written all over it. Firm structure, with crisp acidity. Good aging potential. Best from 2003 through 2010. 2,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Private Reserve
note: A tremendous effort in yet another great Chardonnay vintage in California. This wine is complex and concentrated, with lots of lovely ripe pear, nectarine, citrus and melon flavors, turning spicy with toasty oak notes. Drink now through 2002. 20,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Classic Clare
note: This firm, beautifully framed, elegantly styled Shiraz fleshes out with berry, plum, white pepper and licorice flavors that last and last on the focused finish. Has style and the ability to age. Drink now through 2011. 5,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
note: Fabulous. More like an auslese, this '97 spätlese is rich and zingy yet packed into a lean framework. Pinpoint delineation of lime, grapefruit and slate, intensely displayed on bracing acidity, is followed by a long, long finish. Best from 2002 through 2008. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chablis Les Vaillons Domaine Long-Depaquit
note: Absolutely gorgeous. Ripe, yet focused on the minerally soil of Chablis, this is creamy and refreshingly fruity, with masses of tropical, apricot, fig and pear character, with cream to boot on the buttery, caressing finish. Great winemaking. Best from 2000 through 2006. 3,033 cases made.

name: Meursault La Barre Dessus Clos Marguerite
note: Full-bodied yet incredibly elegant. So refined it smells of little but a vague mineraliness, and it's the same story on the palate--a great concentration of terroir, cream, compact tropical fruit and stone--with good acidity and subtle toastiness. Best from 2006 through 2015. 300 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
note: Wonderful ripe fruit is the hallmark of this lovely California Merlot, which displays rich and complex cherry, currant, anise, cedar and spice flavors. Gains in depth and nuance through the finish, where it keeps pumping out the flavors. Drink now through 2006. 5,208 cases made.

name: Brut Anderson Valley L'Ermitage
note: Rich toasty aromas lead off, introducing a muscularly structured California bubbly that features a fine blend of citrus, hazelnut, spice and green apple flavors. Despite its power, it has plenty of finesse, finishing crisp and clean, with a lingering touch of lemon-lime. Drink now through 2004. 5,700 cases made.

name: Trilogy Napa Valley
note: An impressive red blend, tightly structured, with a rich array of currant, black cherry, anise, cedar, tar and spice flavors of remarkable harmony and finesse, ending in a long, complex aftertaste. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2000 through 2009. 4,100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
note: Ripe, smooth and harmonious, showing layers of currant, cedar, coffee, anise and blackberry, this outstanding California red unfolds to reveal a supple texture, then firms up nicely on the finish. Competitively priced in this category at this score, too. Best from 2000 through 2009. 7,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Old Vines
note: Well oaked, with lots of smoky, toasty flavors, but the fruit stands right up to it, with ripe cherry, raspberry and plum notes. Complex, flavorful aftertaste. Drink now through 2003. 25,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Estate Series
note: A smooth and generous offering from Washington, artfully balanced to showcase its profusion of pear, spice and coconut flavors that meld pleasantly with a hint of beeswax on the long, rich finish. A great value at this price and score, and availability should be good. Drink now through 2004. 39,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Cuvée Frédéric Émile
note: Intensely aromatic, with scents of fresh mint, forest floor and roses that persist right through to the long finish. Steely, lean and structured, this Alsace white is packed with character. A wine for long-keeping. Best from 2000 through 2010. 3,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
note: This New Zealand white displays an impressive range of flavors--green apple, sweet pea, citrus and celery--balanced on an elegant frame, all coming together harmoniously on the tart, silky-textured finish. Delicious. Drink now. 9,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Edna Valley MacGregor Vineyard
note: Openly fruity, touching on exotic, with ripe and lively tropical fruit, Meyer lemon, butterscotch and toasted oak. Turns firm on the finish. Drink now. 10,240 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Smooth, lush and polished, with a pretty array of currant, black cherry, anise, earth, sage and tarry-leathery flavors building to and holding a sharp focus. Needs time, though. Best from 2001 through 2008. 20,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
note: Effusively fragrant, redolent of fig, peach, and herb, this attractive white tastes rich and ripe, serving up layers of fresh grapefruit and melon with country charm, all carried along brightly by tangy acidity. Delicious. Drink now. 31,311 cases made.

name: Barolo
note: Delicate and pure, with gorgeous balance. Light in color, with medium (almost light) body, it has an attractive sweet-tasting quality and appealing silkiness joined by lovely red berry, smoke and mineral notes. Not showy but pleasurable, here's an authentic Piedmont red that grows and grows on the ethereal finish. Drink now through 2007. 10,000 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Anagallis
note: This is an ultrafine Sangiovese. Dark ruby in color, with bright aromas of raspberry, cherry, violet and rose. Full-bodied, with refined tannins and a superlong aftertaste. Best after 2000. 1,665 cases made.

name: Chablis Les Clos
note: Incredibly fresh and vibrant in style, the character of this Chablis verges on green olive, dried herbs and freshly cut grass, but the flavors kick into classy gear on the palate, delivering a smooth mineral-lemon-pear combination on the elegant finish. Bravo. Best from 2003 through 2015. 2,500 cases made.

name: Nuits-St.-Georges Les Chaignots
note: Sleek as a thoroughbred, the tannins are beautifully integrated with great minerally intensity, chalk, toast, spice and black cherry notes, and it has serious terroir etched all over it. Best from 2001 through 2005. 360 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: There's wonderful richness, depth and complexity to this California Cabernet, with its layers of earthy currant, mushroom, cedar, clay, tar and leather. Made in a big, chewy and rustic style, it just needs short-term cellaring. Best from 2001 through 2009. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
note: Plenty of smoky, toasty oak, pear, fig and hazelnut flavors in this smooth, rich and creamy California Chardonnay, turning richer and more complex on the finish, where the oak and fruit surge together. Drink now through 2002. 4,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma County
note: Fresh fig and grapefruit come to mind in this effusively fruity wine that sports bright, refreshing acidity and a sleek, lean body. Hints of freshly mowed grass and minerals add complexity, and the finish is long and delightful. California grapes, Australia-style winemaking. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Victoria Long Paddock
note: What a find at this price and score. A lively white, crisp and juicy, with layers of vibrant apple, nectarine, passion fruit and floral flavors that last on the gentle finish. Wonderful now for its freshness. Drink now through 2001. 30,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Show Reserve
note: Ripe, generous and supple, with pretty plum and currant flavors that persist beautifully on the finish. A bit rough around the edges, which cellaring should soften. Drink now through 2006. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County
note: A deep and concentrated wine, in an opulent style, with layers of rich fig, apricot, pear, spice and nectarine. Long and tasty, it's a very attractive Chardonnay from California's southern end. Drink now through 2002. 2,600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Cold Creek Vineyard
note: Ripe and intense, this outstanding Washington Chardonnay deftly balances its sharply focused core of vibrant pear, apple and citrus flavors against creamy, spicy overtones, the ensemble coming together harmoniously on the long finish. Drink now through 2004. 5,000 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Rioja
note: Ambitious. This deeply colored, highly extracted red has a muscular structure, with mouthfilling tannins that dominate coffee and smoke flavors, which in turn dominate the core of ripe plum, tobacco, licorice and prune flavors. Give it time and watch it soar. Best after 2002. 2,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Coonawarra
note: Ripe and supple, with a chocolate and tobacco edge to the lovely berry, currant and herb flavors that linger through the silky finish. Has power and grace. A terrific wine, period, and even better for the price. Drink now through 2008. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Camelot Vineyard Single Vineyard Series
note: Brimming with complex flavors, this California Chardonnay offers a harmonious blend of ripe pear, nectarine, pineapple and spice, with smoky, toasty oak filling in the gaps nicely. Drink now through 2002. 62,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Russian River Ranches
note: Tight and crisp, with a flinty edge to the narrow band of pear, spice and apricot, slowly unfolding to reveal more nuance and complexity. Best from 2000 through 2004. 75,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Steele Cuvée
note: Lots of up-front fruit and spice make this white distinctive, with tiers of fig, pear, melon, apricot and nutmeg cascading to a long finish with an intricate aftertaste. Even better than last year's version, also a Spectator Selection. Drink now through 2001. 10,000 cases made.

name: Tapestry Reserve Napa Valley
note: Tight in structure while plush in texture, offering rich plum, dark chocolate, cinnamon, spice and earth flavors that linger deliciously on the long, complex finish--this is one seductive California red. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2005. 14,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros
note: Bright and focused, with a tight core of pear, pineapple and citrus, adding touches of mineral and earthiness on the finish. Drink now through 2002. 11,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
note: Here's an outstanding reserve Cabernet at a reasonable price. It's firm, focused and complex, leading off with a smoky, toasty core of oak notes and complementary flavors of ripe black cherry, currant, cedar and tar. Deliciously complex on the finish, where the flavors persist. Drink now through 2007 . 41,375 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Reserva
note: This modern-style red shows plenty of toasty vanilla flavors up front, but there's a solid core of ripe blackberry and black cherry, too. The texture is plush, but crisp acidity keeps the wine lively. It's a polished, impressive mix of suppleness and weight. Drink now through 2005. 18,000 cases made.

name: Moulis
note: Bubbling over with blackberry, cherry and spice, with a hint of coconut. Full-bodied and chewy, yet refined and well manicured. A silky texture that goes on and on. Big and tannic wine. A super effort from Poujeaux. Best after 2001. 24,000 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: Deep, dark ruby with intense aromas of mint, berries and currants. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a delicious ripe fruit and lead-pencil aftertaste. Very fine indeed. Typically outstanding for Lynch-Bages. Best after 2005. 35,000 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: Marvelous aromas of raspberry, coconut and mineral. Full-bodied, with superbly well-integrated yet powerful tannins. Chewy and fruity finish. Needs a lot of time to mellow. Much better than the barrel samples I tasted. Best Pichon-Baron since 1990. Best after 2006. 25,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Berardenga
note: Just as expected from Felsina: a superb Chianti Classico, displaying lots of cherry, berry and wet earth character. The wine is medium-bodied, with medium, silky tannins and a long, flavorful finish. Drink now through 2001. 13,330 cases made.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
note: Plenty of ripe, fresh fruit in this red, with flavors of black cherries, blackberries and plums, along with accents of toast and coffee. Yet it remains smooth and graceful on the palate, with well-integrated tannins and a long, fruity finish. Drink now through 2005. 9,500 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Royal Apanage
note: The concentration is impressive in this intense, aromatic, full-bodied Champagne, with its assertive doughy and toasty aromas leading into flavors of ripe fruit and spices that linger enticingly on the finish. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Smooth and ripe, floral and spicy in character, this Napa red displays tiers of juicy plum, blackberry and black cherry flavors that are complex and vibrant. Quite appealing now; will be even better with cellaring. Best from 2001 through 2007. 8,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
note: Zesty and brimming with fruit describes this Kiwi Sauvignon Blanc--a lively mouthful of apricot, citrus, pear and fennel flavors that keep bouncing merrily through the finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chablis
note: Remarkably intense and rich for a village Chablis, this outstanding white kicks with life, boasting a round mouthfeel and a lovely combination of honey, pear, spice and toast flavors of good complexity and, above all, great length. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey County
note: An enticing California Chardonnay with a complex flavor profile of rich fig, pear, hazelnut and citrus couched in a smooth and creamy texture. A short term in the cellar should add the finishing touches. Drink now through 2003. 39,000 cases made.

name: Coteaux du Languedoc La Copa Santa
note: Quite a mouthful. Dense and incredibly concentrated, with layers of complex yet well-defined flavors of bacon, dark chocolate, ripe plum and raspberry, finishing with mineral and coffeelike notes. Rather plush despite its power, but this French red will need time in the cellar to integrate even further. Best from 2002 through 2008. 3,167 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Scharzhofberger
note: Seductive, bursting with succulent lime and apricot aromas and flavors accented by white pepper. In the mouth, it's rich and racy until the refreshing acidity ushers in a long, multidimensional finish. Great stuff. Drink now through 2010. 700 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Crimea 2 Year Old
note: Delicious sweet wine. Amber-rust colored. Fruit cake with lots of dried fruits on the nose. Medium-bodied and lightly sweet, with a wonderful intensity of caramel and dried fruit character. Fresh finish. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
note: This California Chardonnay is a winner all around. It's firm and bright, offering a solid, snappy core of citrus and mineral along with pretty pear and apple flavors, all mingling on the long, zingy finish. And the price is right. Drink now through 2006. 60,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
note: Bright and inviting, the lively intensity of the complex grapefruit, melon, pear and spice flavors is nicely balanced by a frame of pretty toast and cedary oak in this outstanding California white. Drink now through 2003. 30,000 cases made.

winery: La Granja Nuestra Señora de Remelluri
name: Rioja
note: This ambitious red from Spain has a deep, opaque color, deep, almost charred aromas of coffee and toast and is firmly tannic on the palate, with ripe flavors of coffee, plum, prune and licorice. The wood notes are dominant now, but it has the concentration to improve with age. Best after 2002. 23,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
note: Smooth, rich and polished, with a complex core of herb-laced black cherry, currant, plum and raspberry flavors that soar on the finish, this California red offers an attractive combination of high quality and reasonable price, should be fairly available, too. Best from 2000 through 2004. 14,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley
note: Wonderfully rich and silky, with polished, focused pear, nectarine and toast, showing more nuances of flavor on the finish. Drink now. 21,300 cases made.

name: Haut-Médoc
note: The best Cantemerle in years, beautiful and rich, with a wonderful core of fruit. Pretty plum and berry aromas, with hints of tobacco and chocolate, lead to a full-bodied wine with loads of chocolate and berry character. Long, long aftertaste. Best after 2005. 22,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon Reserve
note: A lovely white, smooth and round on the palate, delivering a generous portion of melon, spicy pear and caramel flavors that linger beautifully, drawing you back for another sip. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County
note: A ripe, supple and harmonious red with an attractive range of plum, dried cherry, anise, sage and spice, holding its focus and bowing out with a long, rich aftertaste. Very impressive--among the best of the '97 California Pinots. Drink now through 2006. 8,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Gisborne
note: Smooth, polished and refreshing for its juicy pineapple, citrus and vanilla-almond flavors that wrap up neatly on the silky finish. Drink now through 2004. 8,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Filsell
note: Ripe and spicy, here's a generous and focused red from Australia, dripping with blackberry, black cherry, anise and leather flavors that keep pumping through the long finish. Its fine tannins can use cellaring. Best after 2001. 5,000 cases made.

name: Rioja
note: A lush and deep red from Spain, with ripe fruit flavors of blackberry and cassis, rich notes of chocolate and toast from new oak and a muscular structure that remains balanced and approachable through the long, spicy finish. A fine example of modern Rioja, it's also a good buy at this price and score. Drink now through 2006. 9,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Erta e China
note: A pretty, balanced Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon blend. Intriguing aromas of plum skin and fresh mushroom have a hint of flowers. Medium- to full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a fruity, minty aftertaste. Best after 2000. 3,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Rheingau Hattenheimer Schützenhaus
note: Authoritative, with a hint of a swagger, but this never loses focus. Shows peach aromas and flavors, but with more smoke and mineral, married to a rich texture and a firm backbone. Fine length of flavor. Drink now through 2007. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pouilly-Fuissé Aged in Oak
note: Lively, racy and full-bodied, this white Burgundy is packed with deftly created oak accents, showing a pronounced toasted character along with plenty of lemon notes, good fruit and impressive length on the finish. It's tempting now, but worth cellaring short-term. Best from 2000 through 2005. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Hawkes Bay
note: Ripe, lively and remarkably elegant and refined, this has distinctive herb- and cedar-scented currant and raspberry flavors that keep spilling over on the long finish. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Cuvée des Seigneurs
note: Aromas and flavors of forest floor, mineral and lanolin are allied to a sleek, steel-plated structure in this impressive Alsace Riesling. Dry, rich and intense, the wine combines freshness and some mature elements that should develop nicely. Drink now through 2005. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
note: Wow. This is a richly concentrated, deftly made Chardonnay that's packed with ripe fruit flavors and layered with creamy, spicy accents that linger on the finish. Full-bodied, almost sweet in its ripeness, but still balanced. Drink now through 2001. 3,500 cases made.

name: Margaux
note: Plenty of blackberry, currant and cherry character. Medium- to full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long, fruity aftertaste. A mellow and well-defined '96. One of the best Issans in ages. Best after 2000. 10,000 cases made.

name: Dolcetto d'Alba Vigna del Mandorlo
note: A Dolcetto of the highest level. Full-bodied, coating the palate with well-integrated tannins as well as mocha, chocolate and mostly black cherry and tar. For this varietal, there's amazing richness on the opulent finish. Tastes unfiltered. A perfect forebear of what the great '98 vintage might bring us. Drink now through 2001. 1,084 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Forster
note: Gorgeous. Exhibiting peach, violet and tropical fruit nuances, this white is concentrated and solidly supported by bracing acidity and power that carries through the finish. Young and unevolved, this shows great potential. Best from 2001 through 2008. 1,200 cases made.

name: DVX Napa Valley
note: A refreshing style of bubbly, with pretty citrus, apple, hazelnut and pear notes. The structure is focused and firm, showing elegance and depth and offering both bright acidity and creamy texture. Long finish. Drink now through 2003. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot d'Alsace Alsace
note: Delicious from start to finish, this gorgeous white bursts with ripe peach, smoke, nut and citrus character. Complex, fresh and beautifully balanced, this is textbook Alsace, a perfect introduction to the region. Drink now through 2001. 2,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Solaia
note: Dark ruby in color, with extremely ripe raisin and spice aromas. Full-bodied and very chewy, with loads of polished tannins and a long, long finish that's big and fruity. A solid, muscular red fromTuscany, this is the greatest Solaia ever made. Best after 2004. 7,000 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
note: Beautifully proportioned, rich and complex, with ripe, concentrated plum, currant, black cherry, mocha, toasty oak and spice nuances. Turns smooth and silky on a long, elegant finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2002 through 2012. 4,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
note: Deliciously ripe, rich and deeply flavored, with juicy layers of coffee, herb, currant, sage, chocolate, toffee and spice, with a long, complex, integrated finish. Best from 2002 through 2012. 2,850 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
note: An explosive and racy Châteauneuf, bursting with roasted game, wild berry, grilled bread, dark chocolate and espresso character. Ripe and sweet-tasting, with enough opulent fruit to balance the firm tannin structure that rises like an impenetrable wall on the spectacular finish. Best from 2005 through 2020. 4,165 cases made.

name: Insignia Napa Valley
note: Superrich and seductive version of this prestigious red, its layers of currant, black cherry, chocolate and ginger turning smooth and polished, with a long, intricate aftertaste. Best from 2002 through 2012. 20,000 cases made.

name: Isosceles Paso Robles
note: Absolutely delicious, this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (mostly), Cabernet Franc and Merlot is brimming with ripe and juicy currant, blackcherry, wild berry, plum and anise flavors that are complex, deep and polished. Finishes long and flavorful. Best from 2002 through 2012. 8,000 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée des Cadettes
note: Seductive and sexy, this world-class red is rich, opulent and ripe, with layers of superb mocha, toast and spice. Loaded with blackberry and cassis, its fabulous balance leads to a long fruit-and-oak finish. Very tempting now. Best from 2005 through 2030. 2,200 cases made.

name: Profile Napa Valley
note: Massive, with wonderful richness, depth and concentration, this Cabernet blend has layers of complex currant, black cherry, plum, vanilla and blackberry and a long, detailed, firmly tannic finish. Best from 2002 through 2012. 5,200 cases made.

name: Bolgheri Ornellaia
note: This Tuscan gem is black in color, with complex aromas of black currants, minerals and wet earth. Full- bodied, with lots of tannins, but very polished. Long, long finish. Super well-made—a great Ornellaia. Best after 2004. 11,415 cases made.

name: Toscana Sammarco
note: Black color. Aromas of blackberries, minerals and mint. Very subtle. Full-bodied, with amazing concentration of silky tannins and a finish that goes on and on. Monumental Sammarco. Best ever for me. Best after 2005. 3,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: An ultrarich and polished Cabernet, superripe and jammy, with a dense concentration of thick and spicy plum, wild berry, black cherry and currant. Finishes with pretty dashes of oak, coffee, chocolate and vanilla. Best from 2003 through 2015. 1,000 cases made.

name: Bolgheri Superiore Guado al Tasso Tenuta Belvedere
note: A balanced and harmonious young red. Dark ruby color, with loads of grape, berry, mineral and violet aromas. Full-bodied, with loads of blackberry and cherry character, fine tannins and a medium finish. Gorgeous wine. Best after 2005.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Montosoli
note: Monster Brunello. Very dark in color, withsuperripe aromas of black licorice, dried plum,mint and meat. Full-bodied, with masses of velvetytannins and a long, long finish. Best version ofthis Tuscan red since the legendary 1990Montosoli. Give it time. Best after 2004. 5,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
note: The greatest modern vintage of Niepoort. Shows a black color and intense aromas of crushed berries and wet earth, with a slight stemminess. Full-bodied and mouthpuckering, this young bodybuilder of a Port has loads of fruit and powerful tannins. Amazingly long finish. Best after 2009. 4,000 cases made.

name: Gigondas
note: Distinguished, deep and complex Rhône, offeringlayers of wet earth, mineral and ripe fruit in aseductive and harmonious combination. Superbmidpalate concentration. Full-bodied and intense,with massive but refined tannins. Still, it needsaging. Best from 2003 through 2020. 2,500 cases made.

name: Hermitage La Chapelle
note: What a great wine. Full-bodied, with crushed berry, smoke and grilled aromas, all presented quite subtly. Stands out for its natural, down-to-earth taste of clean, pure, shining fruit. A pleasure to drink. Tempting now. Best from 2003 through 2015. 7,765 cases made.

name: Barolo Brunate
note: Already tight as a drum, yet glorious aromas of flowers, berries and cherries come forth with air. The wine is full-bodied and very tannic, but has loads of fruit and fresh acidity. Don't touch this monster yet. Best after 2006. 2,380 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard
note: A seamless wine of classic proportions. Ripe, rich and polished, with tiers of pear, citrus, melon, hazelnut and fig culminating in a long, polished aftertaste. Kudos to Kistler. Drink now through 2006. 1,882 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Sorì Burdin
note: Kaleidoscopic character. This Piedmont red offers deep and rich aromas of ripe plum, meat and dried fruit and is full-bodied, with wonderfully polished tannins and a finish of red fruit and spice that goes on for minutes. Best after 2004. 1,000 cases made.

name: Grenache-Syrah-Mourvèdre McLaren Vale GSM
note: Rich and distinctive, a bit lighter than moststraight Aussie Shirazes but dripping withflavors, corralling a wild range of meatyblackberry, red cherry, black cherry and pepperflavors into a smooth wine of enormous characterand depth. Appealing already. Best after 2002. 4,500 cases imported.

name: Tapestry Reserve Napa Valley
note: Big, bold, rich and polished, this is an immense and deeply concentrated Cabernet blend laden with ripe plum, currant, anise, green olive and cedar notes and finishing with gripping tannins. Best from 2002 through 2012. 27,000 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
note: A wonderful, masterful wine. Both firm and opulent, it displays a nice dig into the Rhône terroir as it brings out wet earth, mineral and an interesting, chewy tannin structure. A high-voltage drinking experience, with lots of fruit, spice and mocha. Best from 2003 through 2020. 16,665 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
note: Distinctive, very monolithic, clean, pure and crisp, with fresh fruit zipping along the palate. Turning a bit tough and tannic, it holds back a lot now, delivering little seduction, hiding well its leather, game, truffle and black fruit character, yet it's undeniably balanced. Made to age. Best from 2010 through 2030. 15,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Casalferro
note: A monster Italian red. Aromas of coffee, roastedmeat and ripe berries precede a full-bodied winewith mouthpuckering tannins and an enormousconcentration of fruit. What it lacks in eleganceand sophistication it gives in concentration andpower. Best after 2003. 8,750 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
note: Super. I love the nose of this young Port, which shows raisin, spice and a little stemminess. Full-bodied, medium-sweet, with loads of ripe tannins and a long, long finish. Really racy and exciting. Even better than when tasted from barrel. Best after 2006. 10,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Australia Grange
note: A massive wine, majestic in its proportions,combining power and grace in equal measure. Flavors of plum, blackberry, chocolate and pepper, with hints of cedar, licorice and mint, swirl through the exotic finish. Tannins swarm but don't overwhelm the finish, which echoes all day and night. Best from 2004 through 2020. 9,800 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
note: Sweet-tasting and ripe, sophisticated in its smooth, round and silky mouthfeel, delivering loads of fruit and wet earth. An attractive version of this Rhône red. Drink now through 2015. 7,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville
note: Sturdy, rich and detailed, with complex, earthy currant, sage, mineral, tobacco and anise flavors that fan out and saturate the palate. Finishes with muscular tannins. Best Mondavi Oakville yet. Best from 2002 through 2012.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
note: Lovely. Shows typical Châteauneuf character, withroasted, toasted and grilled notes in a supplepackage. Full of ripe plum and sweet but firmtannins, it's full-bodied and deeply satisfying,retaining its textbook personality through thelingering finish. Drink now through 2015. 3,330 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Polished and stylish, with beautiful violet, blackberry, mocha and Asian spice flavors. Ripe, round tannins are seamlessly integrated, finishing with focused intensity. Drink now through 2008. 7,100 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa-Sonoma Counties
note: Impressive. Espresso-style, deeply concentrated Merlot, boasting a core of rich currant, coffee, black cherry and anise. Firms up on the finish, where a touch of bay leaf adds complexity to the flavor profile. Drink now through 2006. 4,137 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
note: This wine is opulent, rich and creamy, with a core of nectarine, fig, citrus, pineapple and spice supported by firm, lively acidity, finishing long and full. Lovely Chardonnay from a growing California appellation. Drink now through 2005. 9,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Premier Cuvée
note: Ripe, round and distinctive, with juicy, spicy, floral notes around currant and plum flavors that linger long. This Pinot has all its elements packed in tightly and harmoniously. Very classy. Drink now through 2010. 2,809 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Georges de Latour Private Reserve
note: An extraordinary wine, dense, rich and earthy, with broad, plush tannins and tiers of complex currant, earth, cedar, black cherry, mineral and anise flavors. Keeps a tight focus on the long, rich, detailed aftertaste. Best from 2002 through 2010. 17,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Special Selection
note: This banner year's Special Selection is smooth, rich and concentrated, with layers of currant, mocha, black cherry and wild berry, fairly gushing at midpalate. The finish is long, rich, and intricate. Drink now through 2009. 2,000 cases made.

name: Hermitage Monier de la Sizeranne
note: Fabulous. This serious Hermitage digs deep inhillside Rhône soil, with mineral, wet earth andgrilled character. Intense and complex, showing atoasted, smoky essence and loads of blackberryflavors. Refined tannins turn firm and givestructure to the long finish. Best from 2005 through 2020. 1,227 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Estate Series
note: Round and cedary, this Washington red deliversdepth, length and distinctive flavor. Ripe, plushand generous with its exotic, seductive aromas andflavors, layering rich plum, currant and clove ona bed of fine-grained tannins. Great price/scoreratio. Drink now through 2011. 15,000 cases made.

name: Toscana San Martino
note: Big and powerful Tuscan red. Quite dark in color, with an intense blackberry, raspberry and floral character. Full-bodied, with very chewy tannins. Very tight now. Best after 2005. 1,077 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Tremendous flavor, dark, ripe, rich and packed with black cherry, currant, anise, cedar and spice. Finishes with firm but deliciously well-integrated tannins. Best from 2003 through 2012. 2,400 cases made.

name: Gigondas
note: Gorgeous. Savage, exploding with cassis and dried and fresh herb aromas, it produces a most sensual, soft midpalate mouthfeel. Full-bodied, it's subtle despite its rich concentration. Best from 2003 through 2015. 4,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Torre Muga Reserva
note: Beautifully aromatic, with notes of cassis,lilacs, coffee and spices, this sinuous red ispolished and elegant, yet dense with fruit, oakand earthy flavors that linger and expand on thelong finish. An extraordinary marriage of typicityand sophistication. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Command
note: A superrich and jammy Aussie red sporting a wonderful array of black cherry, wild berry, seductive toasty oak and spice nuances. The texture is silky-smooth, the finish a mile-long. Drink now through 2008. 1,800 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Flaccianello
note: This builds and builds and builds on the palate. Gorgeous aromas of ripe berries, meat and spices. Full-bodied, with polished, well-integrated tannins and a long, long finish. Give it time. Best after 2005. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Great structure, deliciously rich and complex, deep and fragrant, with layers of concentrated black cherry, plum, currant and wild berry, picking up pretty spice and floral notes and finishing with a long, lingering finish. Tempting now. Best from 2002 through 2016. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Dark and intense, with a solid, plush core of ripe, rich currant, black cherry, blackberry and light cedar notes. Jam-packed with flavors, it's an immense wine but beautifully balanced. Best from 2002 through 2012. 3,742 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma-Santa Barbara-Monterey Counties Overlook
note: Quite rich and concentrated, with a core of fig, pear, nectarine and spicy oak. Holds its focus, turning elegant and supple. Drink now through 2004. 18,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Altenberg de Bergheim
note: Terrific. Beautiful aromas of flowers, pine forests, peaches and citrus. Rich, creamy and just off-dry midpalate, with firm underlying structure, yet the finish is dry. Still needs time. Drink now through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

name: Gigondas
note: A beautiful, terroir-driven wine. Thick and elegant, with mineral, wet earth, plum and blackberry. Silky midpalate, but tannic and uncompromising on the finish. Needs time. Best from 2004 through 2015. 3,665 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape La Crau
note: Reserved aromatically, but the wonderful balance is evident as this young Rhône red reveals its mineral, wet earth, delicate plum, mocha, coffee and blackberry character and subtle, ripe tannins. The wet earth and mineral really shine through on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2010. 16,665 cases made.

name: Barbaresco
note: Super Barbaresco. Intense aromas of ripe plums, violets and berries lead to a full-bodied palate with chewy tannins. Long finish tastes of superripe fruit. Lovely and powerful wine. Best after 2005. 5,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Tenuta Nuova
note: This is a blockbuster Brunello--the real thing. Tastes very ripe and earthy, with lots of wonderful fruit and wet leaf character. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long finish. Drink now through 2008. 3,945 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa
note: Smooth, polished and positively glowing with fruit and spice flavors, bursting across the palate with gorgeous blackberry, black cherry, anise and cinnamon flavors, swirling in some sweet vanilla and pepper on the long finish. Best from 2002 through 2020. 12,000 cases imported.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée Réservée
note: Superopulent. Full-bodied and thick, with rich, ripe fruit flavors that taste sweet midpalate. Wonderful, supple, velvety finish. Delicious. Drink now through 2015. 6,250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
note: A nice round red, with ripe flavors of black currant, cotton candy, spice and lavish toasty oak. Solid tannins integrate harmoniously with coffee flavors on the finish. Best from 2001 through 2009. 30,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey Sleepy Hollow Vineyard
note: Deep, ripe, rich and concentrated, this outstanding California Chardonnay delivers layers of fig, pear, apple and melon and gains nice oaky touches of hazelnut and cedar before finishing with a burst of fruit. Drink now through 2005. 9,500 cases made.

name: Alexis Napa Valley
note: Weaves together a complex array of rich black cherry, ripe plum, wild berry and floral notes, all sharply focused, finishing with firm tannins and wonderful length. Best from 2002 through 2010. 3,400 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie
note: An explosive, grand Syrah. Complex and deep,layered with twists and turns that spin your tastebuds around merrily. Imagine leather, wet earth,grilled meat, a garden in bloom and blackberrynotes--all of this comes together in thisultrasupple, round, generous red. Best from 2002 through 2010. 2,080 cases made.

name: Priorat Finca La Planeta
note: Intense. First, ripe fruit coats the palate, then darker flavors of coffee, anise and minerals emerge and linger. Firm tannins and high alcohol build an impressive structure. A big wine that needs time to unwind. Best after 2004. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Cold Creek Vineyard
note: Rich, ripe and focused, this Washington Cabernet shows layers of currant, plum and vanilla flavors, with hints of pepper and bay leaf sneaking in on the long, supple finish. Fine-grained tannins. Best from 2001 through 2008. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Beautifully polished, ripe and intricate Cabernet from an awesome vintage, with layers of rich currant, plum, mocha, sage and floral notes, finishing long and firm, with a complex aftertaste. Best from 2002 through 2012. 19,500 cases made.

name: Gigondas
note: Has a subtle, refined, minerally, midpalate sweetness that coats the taste buds. Ends with lovely, light-winged balance and black cherry, blackberry and plum flavors. Best from 2003 through 2015. 5,000 cases made.

name: Gevrey-Chambertin Lavaux St.-Jacques
note: Blockbuster style of red Burgundy. Inky-black in color, full in body, packed with flavors, but also delivering great finesse with its silky tannins. Bold but focused blackberry, wild raspberry, smoke, petrol, and tar complexity. A winner, with its silky texture that endures through a long, balanced finish. Best from 2003 through 2015. 405 cases made.

name: Toscana Vigorello
note: This Tuscan red is big and plummy, full-bodied and tannic, with loads of vanilla and coconut, lots of pepper and berry character, too. Long, slightly hard finish. Needs time to mellow. Best after 2003. 5,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Viña Lanciano Reserva
note: Elegant. This polished Spanish red is bursting with cherry, berry, spice and vanilla flavors that float over fine-grained tannins and linger, fresh and clean, on the long finish. A beautiful example of the traditional style. Drink now through 2006. 13,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sant'Antimo Tavernelle
note: This outstanding Cabernet Sauvignon from Tuscanyhas interesting aromas of ripe fruit and meat,with hints of dried herbs. It's full-bodied andvery concentrated, with plenty of velvety tanninsand a long finish. Give it some time in thebottle. Best after 2001. 7,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Vau
note: Dark purple in color, with wonderful violet, berry and cherry aromas. Full-bodied, medium-sweet, with a solid core of fruit and tannins. Long finish. Subtle. Best Sandeman since the 1960s. Best after 2008. 25,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Coast
note: Ripe and fleshy, with blackberry, chocolate and toffee flavors supported by round tannins that linger on an intense finish. Drink now through 2005. 14,382 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley Reserve
note: Superripe California Merlot, rich and oaky, in an opulent style delivering layers of currant, black cherry, coconut, cedar and spice, and finishing with a long and intricate aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 7,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
note: A wonderful value that is complex, ripe, bold and rich, layered with earth, pear, toast, fig and smoky oak flavors. It's smooth in texture, with a long, full aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 11,159 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville
note: Grows on you. Rich and earthy, with complex herb, currant, sage and cedary oak notes, all folding together nicely and finishing in a concentrated aftertaste. Best from 2002 through 2010. 15,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Laguna Ranch Vineyard
note: Restrained on the nose, this tightly wound Chardonnay turns more complex and sophisticated on the palate, with a core of pear and nectarine flavors and a rich, buttery aftertaste that's long and focused. Drink now through 2006 . 7,400 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Cuvée Sir Winston Churchill
note: Power and intensity in a glass. Bold and full of bread dough and apple, with a marmalade note, married to a big, firm structure, it still seems youthful. A brilliant Champagne that should develop beautifully. Best from 2001 through 2010. 6,250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Intense, with mineral, vanilla, currant and mushroom notes, offering excellent length, with sturdy tannins and chocolate richness on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 9,955 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot McLaren Vale Traditional
note: Dark, ripe and complex, this red blend reveals its depth with layers of ripe plum, blackberry, coffee and earth. Finishes with a wide range of tasty herb flavors and rich, full tannins. Drink now through 2008. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Premium Selection
note: Crisp and fragrant, this Kiwi white delivers a riot of floral and tropical fruit flavors, favoring passion fruit, lime and spicy rose petal notes. Delicious, and affordable, too. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Eroica
note: Offers a bouquet of wonderful flavors, pouring outits pear, apricot, mineral and honey notes.Off-dry but balanced, with enough of a steelybackbone to make the flavors sing. A collaborativeeffort of Chateau Ste. Michelle and Mosel's Dr.Loosen. Wonderful now. Best from 2002 through 2009. 2,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz South Australia Bin 389
note: Fat and flavorful, This is a richly textured red wine that unfolds its ripe black cherry, blackberry and anise flavors like a thick quilt. Soft, warm and generous, with a sweet, supple finish. Drink now through 2008. 15,700 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Rich and layered, with ripe blackberry, cherry and mocha flavors that finish with soft tannins framing mellow herbal and coffee notes. Drink now through 2008. 12,017 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Estate Series
note: A complex, creamy Washington white, rich, long and generous, dripping with pear, honey, nutmeg and clove, the flavors lingering enticingly. Delicious already. Drink now through 2003. 30,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
note: Smooth and generous, with coffee-scented blackberry and spice flavors that mix nicely on the finish and linger surprisingly gently for such a solid wine. Drink now through 2008. 3,600 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Les Closiers
note: Seductive because of the rich fruit and suppletannins, but also the fresh, clean and crispcharacter that cleanses the palate and gives thisfull-bodied, ripe red a sense of elegance andvibrancy. Has raisiny and plummy aromas, withroasted game, grilled lamb chops and cassisjam. Drink now through 2010. 10,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Ürziger Würzgarten
note: A powerful spätlese, this offers an amazing silkiness, harmony and bracing framework, with peach, lime and slate persisting to a long aftertaste. Best from 2001 through 2006. 750 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Estate Vineyards
note: Beautifully proportioned to balance the fruit and oak, generous without being weighty, this Washington red serves up a lush mouthful of ripe berry and spice flavors, dripping with chocolate and sage notes on the polished finish. Drink now through 2007. 20,000 cases made.

name: Clancy's Barossa
note: Entrancing for its pure, focused fruit character, this reputable red centers on blueberry, blackberry and currant that echo beautifully on the long, gorgeous finish. Harmonious and inviting already, it should only gain with cellaring. Drink now through 2010. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Sablet
note: Seductive red for a Valentine's date. A bit earthy--but what amazing texture and ripeness in the midpalate. It just massages the taste buds,offering a hedonistic tasting experience that makes you dream. Mineral from the wet earth, blackberry and massive, sweet tannins. Very terroir-driven. Drink now through 2008. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
note: Bright, jazzy and yummy, with passion fruit, citrus and pear aromas and flavors on a racy frame, this New Zealand white is quite impressive for the price. Lean, lithe and exciting to sip now. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Padthaway
note: Rich and spicy, with a definite honey note along with pear and citrus aromas and flavors, balanced to let the flavors linger nicely, echoing honey and ripe pear. Drink now through 2005. 16,109 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Gisborne
note: Smooth and round, layering its generous pear and nectarine flavors with spicy, floral overtones. The fruit flavors remain lively and balanced throughout, echo beautifully on the rich finish. Drink now through 2009. 10,000 cases imported.

name: Fiano di Avellino
note: An impressive Italian white with layers of tropical fruit and citrus character. It's full-bodied, with wonderful concentration, good acidity and a long, long flavorful finish. Drink now through 2004. 21,000 cases made.

name: Stellenbosch
note: This red makes a statement. Fresh, bold and extravagantly oaked, exuding vanilla, coffee and toast elements, backed by a core of rich, concentrated plum and black currant. Lovely acidity keeps it all lively, and the long finish bodes well for the future. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Shiraz. Best from 2001 through 2008. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Badia a Passignano Riserva
note: Impressive Chianti Classico riserva. Aromas of currants, blackberries and toasted oats. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long, long finish. Still needs time to open. Best after 2001. 10,000 cases made.

name: Morellino di Scansano Riserva
note: This Tuscan red is gorgeous. Emitting beautiful aromas of blackberry, wet earth and toasted oak, it's full-bodied and very polished, with fine tannins and a fresh, delicious finish. Needs time. Best after 2000. 2,590 cases made.

name: Barbaresco
note: A wonderfully crafted red, with complex aromas of ripe fruit, Indian spice and tea. Full-bodied, with extremely polished tannins and a finish that goes on for minutes. Drink now through 2006. 4,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
note: Seamless. This red is a beautiful combination of ripe fruit, powerful structure and polished texture. Lush flavors of blackberries and plums are supported by firm, ripe tannins and give way to coffee and mineral notes on the long finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,200 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
note: A textbook auslese, literally bursting with apricot, nectarine, lime and mineral. Clean and beautifully balanced, with the sweetness playing off the vivid acidity and silky texture. Already delicious, this should age gracefully. Drink now through 2010. 600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sicilia
note: Here's an Italian white that tastes like a villageMeursault from Lafon; very impressive. Golden incolor, with very ripe pineapple and apricot aromasplus hints of vanilla and dough. Full in body,with lots of unctuous fruit and a long, longfinish. Drink now through 2003. 5,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Vorbourg Clos St.-Landelin
note: A hint of residual sugar provides opulence, but also hides the searing acidity in this powerful, monolithic white. Apple, honey and marmalade accents hold court, ending with a satisfying aftertaste. Best from 2001 through 2005. 1,480 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Ebenezer
note: Firm in texture, with juicy plum, blackberry and rose petal flavors, the fruit echoing enticingly amid the fine-grained tannins on the finish. Appealing already, but it's destined for a long life. Drink now through 2012. 3,500 cases made.

name: Corton-Charlemagne
note: Vibrant. Clean and lively, with lovely midpalate concentration, this medium- to full-bodied white Burgundy is straight as an arrow. Fabulous balance of subtle toasted oak and ripe fruit. An ager. Best from 2002 through 2008. 4,830 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Spitzer Singerriedel
note: Multidimensional. Intense aromas of licorice and spice combine with a broad structure and thick texture that feels more like that of a red wine. Closed now, so be patient. Best from 2001 through 2006. 625 cases made.

name: Bolgheri Superiore Ornellaia
note: A cool and sleek Tuscan red, with tarragon and fresh sage aromas, blackberry and cherry undertones. Full-bodied, with a wonderfully silky palate of fine tannins and a long, fruity finish. Very sophisticated and reserved. Best after 2004. 13,330 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
note: Subtle, complex and refined, with aromas of cherry, licorice, mineral, berry and other sweet, ripe fruit. Full-bodied and compacted, with masses of fine, silky tannins. Long, long finish. Best after 2010. 8,330 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
note: Extraordinarily rich, deep, complex and concentrated, yet remarkably elegant and graceful, this deft red blend reveals layers of exotic spice, black cherry, currant, coffee, tobacco and cedary notes ending in a long, complex aftertaste. Best from 2002 through 2008. 3,500 cases made.

name: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano Grandi Annate Riserva
note: Emits phenomenal aromas of crushed berries, roses, lilacs and currants. Full-bodied, with an incredible backbone of ultrafine tannins and a long, fruity finish. Not big and thick, but powerful and subtle. A very special wine indeed; the greatest Vino Nobile ever made. Hard not to drink it now. Best after 2005. 2,600 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
note: Wonderful aromas of ripe fruit, Indian spices and mineral. Full-bodied, with fine tannins and a plush structure that caresses every inch of your palate. Really fine and fabulous. Much better than from barrel. Best ever from this estate. Best after 2010. 4,580 cases made.

name: Bolgheri Superiore Guado al Tasso
note: Wonderful balance here. Violet and berry aromas, with intense tarragon and currant character. Full-bodied and gorgeous, with wonderful finesse and subtlety. Very long. Best after 2005. 9,500 cases made.

name: Barolo
note: Unbelievable quality. Made in serious quantity. Glorious aromas of crushed flowers, prunes, cedar and cigars. Full-bodied, thick and tannic, yet ripe and round, with a sleek, caressing finish. A classic Barolo that is well-priced. Best after 2005. 6,200 cases made.

name: Crozes-Hermitage
note: Gorgeous. Black in color, supple in texture, rich and thick, with lots of pure black- and red-fruit aromas jumping out of the glass. This Rhône red is full-bodied, with distinctive wild herbs, pine forest, garrigue-like aromas that go on and on. Fabulously long finish. Drink now through 2012. 6,500 cases made.

name: Pessac-Léognan
note: This young Bordeaux shows intense aromas of wet earth, stone and berries. It's full-bodied, with super well-integrated tannins and a long, long finish. Very well made indeed, and much better than when tasted from barrel. Best after 2008. 9,165 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Brune et Blonde
note: Caresses the palate. Elegant, with mineral, red and black fruit and supple tannins. Seductive balance on the fresh finish, where the firm tannins make a surprise appearance that suggests a bit of cellar time is needed to bring out the best of this red. Best from 2003 through 2010. 31,665 cases made.

name: Pomerol
note: Captivating aromas of wild raspberry, cherry, mineral and grilled meat mark this full-bodied wine, along with huge,silky tannins and an extra-long, caressing finish. Envelops the palate like a perfectly tailored silk shirt. Incredible class, with everything in wonderful proportions. The greatest L'Evangile ever made. Best after 2010. 3,000 cases made.

name: Vallagarina
note: Black ruby in color, intense aromas of blackberries, licorice, red berries and green tobacco, this is a full-bodied red with loads of silky tannins and a long, long aftertaste of tobacco, sage and berry. A huge core of fruit in this wine. Needs time. An Italian interpretation of great Bordeaux from bygone days. Best after 2006. 7,450 cases made.

name: Gigondas
note: Lovely and mineral-tasting, with black fruit galore. Full-bodied and fleshy, ripe and balanced, with sweet tannins turning chewy on the long, smooth finish. Drink now through 2010. 6,250 cases made.

name: Gigondas
note: Rich and ripe, a lovely and seductive Rhône red. Packed with wild herb, plum and blackberry complexity, it caresses the palate with its rich fruit and silky tannins. Full-bodied, with mineral, slight smoke, leather and game character on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 4,165 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
note: A blockbuster. Black in color, with extremely grapey, toasted oak and dark chocolate aromas. Full-bodied, with loads of big, velvety tannins and a long, long finish. Best Clos de L'Oratoire ever. Best after 2010. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Cold Creek Vineyard
note: Vibrant and juicy Chardonnay, beautifully focused to show off its creamy pear, tangy citrus and generous pineapple aromas and flavors, which linger effortlessly on the impeccably balanced finish. Drink now through 2007. 5,000 cases made.

name: Reserve Napa Valley
note: A big, rich, dense and distinctive California red that adds some earthy, leathery dimensions to its appealing core of currant and plummy, minerally Cabernet fruit flavors. Tightens on the finish, with mouthcoating tannins. Best from 2003 through 2012. 3,486 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Australia Grange
note: A massive wine, with cascades of potent plum, cherry and blackberry fruit swirling around wafts of black pepper, bay leaf and exotic spice, which last and last on the finish, hinting at smoky, meaty notes. It's all packed in tightly, suggesting this should evolve spectacularly with age. Best after 2005. 10,228 cases made.

name: Pessac-Léognan
note: A tight and muscular young wine. Very floral on the nose, with gorgeous berry and cherry. Full-bodied, with silky tannins and a long, fresh and fruity finish. Very fine and harmonious. Best after 2008. 6,500 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
note: A tightly wound thoroughbred, with complex nut and biscuit notes playing off a floral freshness. Driving it all is a racy acidity matched by a seamless elegance and innate power that lingers through the persistent ginger-tinged finish. Will age beautifully. Drink now through 2008. 1,200 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
note: Aromas of mineral, berry, flowers and cherry. Full-bodied, with silky tannins and a long and fruity finish. I love this. Outstanding for this estate. Best after 2008. 3,000 cases made.

name: Syrah McLaren Vale Basket Pressed
note: Crisp and juicy Shiraz, rich with fruit, bursting with flavor, offering a cascade of bright berry, guava, plum and anise flavors, echoing with a distinctive black pepper note on the spicy finish. Fine-grained tannins don't get in the way. Drink now through 2012. 8,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
note: A full-blown Chardonnay, opulent, lush and creamy, displaying juicy fig, tangerine, pear, pineapple and melon flavors that are neatly layered and persist for a long finish, where pretty notes of toasty oak fold in. Delicious. Drink now through 2004. 13,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma-Santa Barbara-Monterey Counties Overlook
note: Smooth, rich and creamy on the palate, this Chardonnay offers a charming array of spice, pear, apple, tangerine, pineapple, fig and guava flavors, staying tightly focused, turning elegant and sophisticated. Drink now through 2005. 18,000 cases made.

name: Langhe Sperss
note: A superb Sperss, with refined aromas of minerals, flowers, berries and just a hint of mint. Full-bodied and powerful, with chewy tannins and a long berry, cherry and mineral aftertaste. Impressive structure. Best after 2005. 2,000 cases made.

name: Gigondas Le Grand Montmirail
note: Fantastic. Dark and deep, with lots of black fruit, this is as silky a red as you can imagine—all cream and smoothness and seduction. Full-bodied, it kicks in with a touch of fresh fruit character on the long, juicy finish. Massive, sweet tannins lurk in the background, so it should age. Drink now through 2010. 3,750 cases made.

name: Pessac-Léognan
note: A wine bursting with berry and green tobacco character, plus lots of currant, raisin and spice aromas. Full-bodied, with full, velvety tannins and a long aftertaste of tobacco and earth. Mouthpuckering. Best DC in years. Best after 2006. 7,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Loibenberg
note: Brilliant effort. Amply proportioned and spicy, this '99 Riesling combines fascinating smoke, quince and peach flavors with a vibrant structure that drives the flavors. Explodes on the finish with a potpourri of mineral and spice. Drink now through 2006. 1,200 cases made.

name: Coteaux du Languedoc Bronzinelle
note: A powerhouse red from the south of France. Rich and complex, with vivid and well-defined flavors of dark plum, meat and spice. Deeply colored with a meaty aroma, this has the stuffing to age. Peppery and brickish notes linger on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Sicilia
note: A triumph. Masses of ripe apple, toasted oak, with dried pineapple, mango and apricot aromas. Full-bodied, with super flavors, yet it remains fresh and lively on the palate. The "full monty" for Chardonnay.  Drink now through 2004. 6,665 cases made.

name: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano Riserva
note: Ripe and powerful aromas of berries and smoke, with hints of raisins. Full-bodied and massive in the mouth, with big, velvety tannins and a long, long finish. A blockbuster riserva. Best after 2004. 7,100 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
note: A big, new-wave wine. Extremely grapey, with toasted oak, grilled and berry aromas. Full-bodied, with big, velvety tannins and a long finish. A crowd pleaser. Monbousquet is serious. Best after 2008. 7,000 cases made.

name: Bolgheri-Sassicaia Sassicaia
note: Lovely, subtle yet complex aromas of currants, sage and green olives lead to a full-bodied red with a solid core of fruit and well-integrated tannins. Still very reserved on the finish, but those who are patient should be rewarded. Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2005. 13,000 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
note: Supple, balanced and subtle. Traditional Châteauneuf that emphasizes the sweet, ripe fruit, mineral character of the land, and roasted, plummy notes. Medium- to full-bodied, it's delicious from start to finish. Drink now through 2010. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pomerol
note: Like a whirlpool of fruit that draws you to the center. Full-bodied, with wonderfully silky tannins and a finish that lasts for minutes. Drink now. 3,300 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
note: California in St.-Emilion. Black color, with spice, coffee and tobacco aromas. Full-bodied and thick, with loads of fruit and velvety tannins. A blockbuster. Best after 2008. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
note: Sharply focused, rich and complex, this is an impressive Chardonnay, with pretty pear, fig, melon and apricot flavors. Turns spicy, with anise and cedar, and finishes with a long and lively aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 13,928 cases made.

name: Verona Palazzo della Torre
note: This Veneto red is glorious and rich, yet sophisticated. Dark ruby color, it emits aromas of raisins and berries, and hints of cocoa and spice. It's full-bodied, with chewy yet velvety tannins and a long, long finish. Best after 2001. 11,000 cases made.

name: Chablis Premier Cru
note: Amazing. This is a beautiful Chablis, tightly structured and very refined, expanding its mineral base to encompass some vanilla, ripe fruit, honey and slightly spicy oak. Medium-bodied and very long on the finish, it just keeps riding into the sunset. Best from 2003 through 2010. 16,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Grand Estates
note: Rich and vibrant, beautifully focused to show off its plush honey, spice and smoke-accented pear and apricot flavors. Finish is seductively polished and as smooth as a Jean Arp sculpture. Drink now through 2005. 120,000 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages
note: Delicious and stylish young red, balancing fresh, focused and ripe fruit, clean and pure, with mineral, spice, mocha and coffee notes. Dark-colored and medium-bodied, its tannins are sweet, and there's pure fruit on the lively finish. Drink now through 2007. 40,000 cases made.

name: Riesling South Australia Gold Label
note: Wonderfully aromatic Riesling, its glorious noseful of apricot and floral notes segueing into off-dry flavors that center around lime and apple, with mineral and peppery-floral overtones. Tempting now, but should develop more depth and texture with age. Best from 2003 through 2010. 7,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Bin 61
note: This rich, complex red drips with juicy blackberry, cherry and exotic spice flavors, weaving in hints of game and pepper as everything lingers on the long finish. Tannins are soft, making the wine seductive. Drink now through 2010. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Private Reserve
note: The smoky, toasty, figgy, buttery aromas of this enticing white lead to similar rich flavors running deep and persistent, picking up notes of pear, apricot, citrus and melon. Finish zooms on and on. Drink now through 2004. 20,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: A rich, complex and concentrated mouthful, delivering ripe plum, black cherry, blackberry and mineral flavors and finishing with a firm core of tannins, this '97 is a tremendous value as both a ready to drink and an ageable Cabernet. Best from 2002 through 2009. 29,317 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Sonoma County
note: A dazzling red, dark, rich and exuberant, this wine reveals layers of peppery plum, black cherry and blueberry fruit that turn lush, with smooth tannins. Great example of its type. Drink now through 2008. 8,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
note: Bright and lively, beautifully proportioned New Zealand white, juicy with cascades of melon, apple and passion fruit flavors that echo on the finish against a note of bracing acidity. Drink now. 8,900 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
note: Fantastic aromas of berry, chocolate and cherry. Full-bodied, with silky tannins and a long, long finish. Very well done. A château on the rise. Best after 2006. 9,580 cases made.

name: Rioja Gran Reserva
note: Lovely. This youthful red is both elegant and concentrated, with spice, licorice and gamy notes accenting a core of ripe cherry. It's supple, yet firm enough for food. Drink now through 2010. 20,000 cases made.

name: Moulin-à-Vent Aged in Oak
note: Raspberry confiture aroma draws you in, then a blast of black cherry and cassis hits the palate, followed by sweet smoke, vanilla and cinnamon notes. Flavors drip off the back end, but stay elegant and refreshing all the way through. Drink now through 2002. 12,000 cases made.

name: Crozes-Hermitage Les Pierrelles
note: Ultrathick and concentrated Crozes; the liquid hangs on to the inside of the glass as you swirl it. The wine has mineral, iron, wet earth and ripe, clean fruit character that seduces, thanks to the sweetness of the whole package. Full-bodied, tough and long, this needs time in the cellar to smooth out. Best from 2005 through 2012. 5,415 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
note: Fabulous. Deep and rich, very sweet and ripe, a complex wine, with roasted game, plum, blackberry, smoke, leather and grilled meat. Full-bodied, with a long-lasting finish. Drink now through 2010. 3,750 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey Great Estates
note: Maintains a sense of elegance and finesse, even with its rich, creamy core of earth, pear, fig, citrus, hazelnut and nectarine flavors. Long and complex on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 4,029 cases made.

name: Rioja Viña Lanciano Reserva
note: Powerful and still youthful, this dark and muscular red from Spain has firm, ripe tannins supporting ripe, fresh flavors of black cherry, cassis, vanilla and licorice. A fine example of the international style. Drink now through 2010. 14,000 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape White
note: White Châteauneuf with beautiful clean, fresh, juicy, ripe fruit. Mingles honey, fresh figs, apricot and loads of other stuff. It's medium- to full-bodied, long and amazingly attractive. Drink now through 2010. 5,665 cases made.

name: Gigondas
note: Beautiful. Subtle, supple and elegant, this medium-bodied, ripe Gigondas also delivers lovely plum, mineral, roasted game and other flavors. Exciting, long finish, layered with fat tannins. Drink now through 2010. 4,580 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
note: Sophisticated. A dry-style, elegant rosé, displaying complex flavors of citrus, dough, honey and flowers, with a light oxidative note. Really harmonious and long in the mouth, with a dense, creamy texture and excellent length. Walnut aftertaste. Drink now through 2003. 4,000 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
note: Intense aromas of ripe berries, tobacco and toasted oak with mineral. Full-bodied, with well-integrated, superfine tannins and a long, long finish. Extremely sexy, yet elegant. Best after 2008. 6,665 cases made.

name: Toscana Campaccio
note: A lovely, juicy wine, with very soft and polished tannins, ripe and smoky fruit and a long and beautiful finish. This is gorgeous. The best Terrabianca in years. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2003. 7,915 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County The Beaux Frères Vineyard
note: Bright, supple and open-textured, offering disarmingly pure currant and blackberry flavors that linger elegantly on the extra-long finish. Not a blockbuster; it's just yummy and refined. Tannins aren't intrusive, making it tempting to drink already. Drink now through 2009. 3,100 cases made.

name: Fronsac
note: Subtle aromas of mineral, berry, cherry and licorice. Full-bodied, with wonderfully polished tannins and a long, long finish. Amazing quality for this estate. One of the great buys of the vintage. Best after 2008. 5,000 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Rasteau
note: Traditional-style red that's worth hunting down. Digs the earth. Medium-bodied, it kicks up mineral and terroir, while also delivering a mouthful of beautifully ripe, black fruit and lots of firm tannins. Honest wine, without fancy oak, that will improve and soften with age. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
note: This stylish white has more pizzazz than most. Crisp in texture, ripe in flavor, with passion fruit and pear flavors up front, picking up hints of mint, celery and grapefruit as the finish lingers and lingers. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Eroica
note: Zingy, juicy and flavorful. A beautifully packaged cascade of apple, pineapple, apricot and mineral flavors that just don't quit, echoing on the lively finish. It's off-dry, but with a steely backbone and tremendous intensity. Graceful finish. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases made.

name: Gattinara
note: A poor man's Barolo, with mocha, smoky tea and dried fruit on the nose, and superripe, thick and rich fruit, verging on raisins. Full-bodied, with soft, silky tannins and a juicy, pruny finish. Hard not to drink it now. Best after 2005. 17,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Toscana Poggio alla Gazze
note: Aromas of peach, flint, gunpowder and ripe fruit come from this full-bodied yet reserved Tuscan white, with fine acidity and a long, long, flavorful finish. A Sauvignon with finesse, like a fine Pouilly-Fumé. Drink now. 6,665 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros Red Shoulder Ranch
note: Sleek, rich and elegant, this Chardonnay offers a pretty array of fig, pear, anise, nectarine, toasty oak and hazelnut nuances, then finishes with a gush of flavors. Drink now through 2005. 7,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Casalferro
note: Wonderful aromas of blackberries, mineral, licorice and fruit lead to a full-bodied, with big, velvety tannins and a long, succulent, fruity aftertaste. Generous and rich. Mostly Sangiovese. A consistent top wine from Tuscany. Best after 2004. 8,800 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
note: A big, Porty, raisiny wine. Very ripe plum and hints of mineral and spice on the nose. Full-bodied, thick and rich, with big, silky tannins. Slightly hot finish. Rather rustic but impressive. Best after 2006. 6,665 cases made.

name: St.-Julien
note: Well done. Aromas of black truffles and ripe fruit introducing a full-bodied wine with lots of fruit and velvety tannins. A mouthful. Amazing for the vintage in the Médoc. Best after 2006. 18,330 cases made.

name: Magnificat Napa Valley
note: Appealing from start to finish. It's smooth and seductive, with pretty toasty oak, spice, currant and black cherry flavors. Mocha, raspberry and cinnamon come in on the finish, along with plush tannins. Great length. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2010. 11,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Reserve
note: Supple in texture and lively in flavor, this elegant New Zealand Sauvignon shows minty lime, apple and passion fruit flavors that linger through the finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Crozes-Hermitage Les Jalets
note: Very ripe style. Smells and tastes like licorice, and borders on being raisiny but, oh boy, is this a thick, rich and creamy Rhône red. Full-bodied, inky black and very tannic, delivering lots of fruit and lots of oak, this is a big Syrah. Give it time to settle down. Best from 2003 through 2010. 7,415 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
note: Very tightly wound at this stage, here's a racy, intense Riesling full of finely etched lime, rhubarb and slate flavors. Be patient, it has all the elements. Best from 2002 through 2008. 4,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Catena Lunlunta Vineyards
note: Serious Malbec. Dense, with a brooding feel to the smoky currant, plum and spice flavors, this Argentine red is really packed with fruit, with ripe, thick tannins coming in on the finish. Just needs a little time to strut its stuff. Best from 2002 through 2004. 9,900 cases made.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra Bin 128
note: Rich flavors of dark berry and cherry are balanced against a wiry backbone of fine tannins and acidity in this outstanding Shiraz, gaining momentum on the finish. Impressive for its intensity and elegance. Drink now through 2010. 82,489 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Cuvée Frédéric Émile
note: Ultraseductive, this Riesling offers suave notes of smoke, quince, peach and stone allied to a steely structure. Beautifully integrated, its velvet fabric buffers the intensity of the fruit and acidity. Great finish. Drink now through 2008. 3,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Chalone
note: A ripe, rich, complex and concentrated California Chardonnay, with layers of ripe pear, fig, citrus and nectarine. Turns creamy and buttery in texture, with a long, full aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 24,310 cases made.

name: Pomerol
note: Racy and exciting red. Porty. Licorice, berry, coffee, mineral aromas, with hints of wild raspberries. Full-bodied, with silky tannins and a long, long finish. Best after 2008. 3,830 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
note: Bright and zingy, with lime, green apple and grapefruit flavors mingling nicely right through the lively finish, picking up a welcome touch of cream flavor as well. Drink now. 19,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
note: Lots of shirt-collar-grabbing verve in this serious South African Sauvignon, a vibrant mix of lime, cut grass, sweet pea and chalk, with good, medium-weight texture and a long, juicy finish. Drink now through 2003. 11,000 cases made.

name: Coteaux du Languedoc Pic St.-Loup
note: An elegant, well-balanced red, with a chocolaty aroma and pure flavors of red plum and berry. Finishes with brickish and mineral notes.  Drink now through 2003. 4,300 cases made.

name: Puente Alto
note: This has a laser beam of currant and cassis running through its densely textured palate. Extra notes of cocoa powder, mineral and smoke come in on the finish. Densely structured, but the tannins are sweet and finely grained. A serious wine for the cellar. Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2002 through 2006. 12,000 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
note: An outstanding LBV. Black in color, with wonderful aromas of blackberries, cherries and licorice, it's full-bodied and medium sweet, with soft tannins and a long finish. Delicious now and will improve with age. Great value considering the quality. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2008. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Berardenga
note: Lots of dried cherry and crushed black fruit, with polished leather and mineral notes. Medium-bodied, with good acidity on the palate, well-integrated tannins and a well-balanced and fresh finish. Give it a little time in bottle. Best from 2002 through 2005. 14,165 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore La Rocca
note: Hard to believe it's a Soave. Super, with wonderful late-harvest aromas of honey, light butterscotch and straw, this wine is full-bodied, with lots of ripe fruit and a long, long creamy, fruity aftertaste. Drink now. 3,330 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Great Estates
note: A tremendous effort, very rich and full-bodied, with plush tannins wrapped around a complex, concentrated core of earthy currant, toasty oak, hints of sage and chocolate and rich black cherry fruit. Beautifully focused, elegant and tapered on the long, detailed finish. Drink now through 2008. 4,280 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Bella Oaks Vineyard
note: Supple and elegant, a very impressive style, with creamy black cherry, currant, plum, olive, dill and spice. Finishes with polished tannins and a lingering aftertaste. Drink now through 2009. 4,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
note: Ripe, round and distinctive for its layers of gamy, peppery, spicy notes that surround the rich core of black cherry and blackberry flavors. Tannins are polished, but present. Drink now through 2006. 7,675 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Cairanne Cuvée Prestige
note: Beautiful. Rich, ripe, thick and flavorful. The sweet-tasting fruit and lush tannins make for an opulent red with smoke, mineral, grilled meat, plum and blackberry character. Balanced. Drink now through 2015. 1,500 cases made.

name: Stellenbosch
note: Shows serious concentration to its streamlined cassis, briar and currant flavors, framed by suave toast and mineral notes. The flavors really glide on the persistent finish. As good as I've had from the region, and back on form after the subpar '97. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now through 2004. 2,900 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
note: Terrific from start to finish. Aromatic, densely flavored and rich, with slate, lime and peach elements on a seamless, well-defined structure. The finish takes on another dimension, and makes it look effortless. Drink now through 2012. 1,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Reserve
note: Packs in lots of delicious flavors, with layers of ripe plum, currant, cedar, anise, sage and mineral, finishing with a long, full aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 2,894 cases made.

name: Lagrein Alto Adige Steinraffler
note: A blockbuster red. Esoteric. Black-ruby color. Intense aromas of cooked fruits and grilled meat. Full-bodied and very chewy, with a long, long finish. Like a top Syrah. Best after 2003. 1,500 cases made.

name: Margaux
note: Subtle aromas of violet, berry and crushed raspberry. Medium- to full-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a long, fine finish. Tasted good from barrel, but it's outstanding now. Incredible effort from this estate. Best after 2007. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
note: This young Chardonnay impresses with its ripe, complex flavors—rich layers of fig, honey, apricot, honeysuckle and citrus, turning elegant and sophisticated. Drink now through 2006. 2,100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
note: Harnesses the rich, ripe flavors of Cabernet into a supple, seductive package, layering its dark cherry, plum and spice flavors on a plush frame. The flavors echo endlessly, suggesting this will only get better with cellaring. Drink now through 2008. 2,070 cases made.

name: Coteaux du Languedoc Pic St.-Loup Grande Cuvée
note: A full-bore, meaty French red, showing ripe flavors and aromas of dark plum, cassis and blackberry with exotic spicy and mineral elements. Dark chocolate, roasted plum and espresso notes make for an intense and long-lasting finish. Best from 2002 through 2007. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Castello di Brolio
