note: Dark ruby color, with lots of chocolate, berry and vanilla aromas, this is full-bodied and velvety, with lots of fruit and a long, succulent finish. A beauty from a great vintage. Best from 2001 through 2006. 17,000 cases made.

name: Barolo Zonchera
note: Intense aromas of rosebushes and fruit. Full-bodied, with plenty of juicy fruit and chewy tannins. Needs time to open. Best after 2005. 6,300 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
note: Distinctive Châteauneuf, with plenty of wild mushrooms, wet earth, game and leather. This is not a fruit bomb; it has chewy tannins. But underneath is wonderful sweet fruit, as well as a subtle mineral caress. Something special. Best from 2005 through 2015. 13,330 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Cinq Cépages
note: Gorgeous Cabernet, offering a mix of ripe, rich, fleshy currant and blackberry fruit, with hints of herb, olive and sage. Finishes with a firm, structured backbone and ripe tannins giving it depth and richness. Drink now through 2014. 13,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
note: A Brunello for everyone. Solid and focused, with mineral, blackberry and licorice character. Full-bodied and very chunky, with lots of round tannins and a long, long finish. Needs time to open. Best after 2003. 32,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District
note: A tour de force. Deliciously rich and complex, with layers of juicy plum, black cherry, currant and wild berry shaded by anise, cedar, earth and mineral flavors, it fairly gushes with fruit on the finish, yet should age gracefully for another decade, maybe more. Best from 2004 through 2015. 5,067 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: An immense effort, dark, rich and deeply concentrated, packed with layers of rich currant, chocolate, mocha, cherry and herbal nuances. Finishes with a powerful, persistent aftertaste, rich, ripe tannins and wonderful complexity. Best from 2003 through 2012. 12,280 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Dusty berry, currant, anise and cedary oak aromas follow through to a rich, concentrated core of flavors on the palate; yet for all its weight, there's a sense of suppleness and grace, with a rich curranty aftertaste. Best from 2004 through 2012. 4,240 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Pian delle Vigne
note: Amazing Brunello. Fantastic aromas of blackberries, flowers and minerals. Captivating. Full-bodied, with incredible layers of ripe fruit and silky tannins. The finish last for minutes. Racy and firm now. Give it some bottle age. Best from 2004 through 2014. 12,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Castelgiocondo
note: Superbly crafted. Pretty aromas of black cherry, cream and licorice. Full-bodied, yet incredibly tight and smooth, with ultrafine tannins and a long, long, velvety finish. Best after 2004. 12,000 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
note: Big wine, but so refined and sleek, it comes across as delicate on the palate. Plenty of finely tuned oak, with vanilla, chocolate and mocha aromas that blend into the sweet red and blackberry to produce a classy and satiny wine that is surprisingly aristocratic for this appellation. Like a charming red Burgundy from Chambolle-Musigny. Drink now through 2010. 17,165 cases made.

name: St.-Julien
note: Warm and exciting wine from a slightly frigid vintage. Black ruby color. Rich and powerful nose, with loads of currant, smoke and tobacco. Full-bodied and silky, polished and long. Best after 2005. 15,000 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
note: A wine of great intensity, depth and complexity. Beautifully crafted, ripe, rich and creamy, showing off pretty vanilla and mocha-scented oak before a deep core of currant, blackberry, black cherry and minerally flavors fold in. Firm tannins add structure on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best from 2004 through 2014. 7,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
note: An enormously complex and sophisticated wine that combines great flavors with uncommon finesse. Dark, sleek, rich and polished, with a delicious core of concentrated cola, currant, plum and blackberry. Tremendous finish. Best from 2004 through 2014. 20,000 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: Complex aromas of blackberries, tobacco, spices and black licorice are alluring in this full-bodied claret, with a solid core of fruit and silky tannins. Long, caressing finish. Superfine, well-structured. Best after 2006. 22,500 cases made.

name: Barolo Ciabot Mentin Ginestra
note: Breathtaking. Big and powerful, with loads of plum, blackberry, raisin and meat aromas. Full-bodied, with big, luscious tannins and masses of fruit on the palate. Long and rich. Seductive. Best after 2007. 1,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros
note: Sleek, yet deceptively rich and complex. Deeply concentrated and full of ripe fig, pear, citrus, light toasty oak and hazelnut flavors. Sharply focused and long on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 2,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Grand Estates
note: Rich and creamy, a plush mouthful of peach, pear, nutmeg and cream flavors that wind themselves nicely all the way through the generous finish. Inexpensive and more than plentiful. Drink now through 2003. 185,000 cases made.

name: Uriah Walla Walla Valley
note: Ultrasmooth and gently spicy, a gorgeous rainbow of plum, cherry, cedar, chocolate and exotic spice flavors that play across a supple frame, polished to a deep sheen and echoing forever. Drink now through 2010. 1,200 cases made.

name: Merlot Alexander Valley
note: Rich and spicy, with exotic chocolate, black cherry, plum, nutmeg and light toasty, mocha-scented oak and coffee grounds. Elegant, complex and concentrated, it's a mouthful of Merlot that should age well for another decade. Firm, chewy tannins sneak up on you. Best from 2003 through 2012. 27,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sicilia
note: Full-throttle Chardonnay, with all the Burgundy treatment (like a juicy Meursault) you could hope for. Loads of apple, vanilla and pineapple character. Full-bodied, with loads of fruit and a long, butterscotch and ripe fruit aftertaste. Glorious. Drink now. 6,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Delicious black cherry, spicy plum and blackberry flavors are well-centered, offering depth and richness and finishing with firm tannins wrapped around a core of mocha-laced oak. Drink now through 2009. 16,934 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Vigna di Pianrosso
note: Beautiful, with blackberry, perfumed violet and milk chocolate aromas. Full-bodied, with loads of jammy, chocolaty fruit and big, velvety tannins. Lasts for minutes on the palate. Glorious now, but will age for a very long time. Best after 2004. 2,500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Montosoli
note: Complex aromas of grilled meat and cherry, with hints of cedar and tobacco turning to plums and flowers. Full-bodied and extremely well-structured, with well-integrated tannins and ripe and concentrated fruit. Superbly made. Best after 2004. 2,200 cases made.

name: Toscana Ghiaie della Furba
note: Fantastic. Very ripe and rich, with raisin and cured beef character. Full-bodied, with big, velvety tannins and a long, long finish. A massive but impressive red. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah. Best after 2005. 3,250 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Tenuta Nuova
note: Like finely meshed cashmere. Exotic aromas of plums, incense and Indian spices. Full-bodied, with very fine tannins and a long, caressing, silky aftertaste. A wine with loads of finesse. Give it time. Best after 2004. 4,580 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
note: With firm texture and beautiful focus, this powerful, seamless wine has a distinctly gamy note weaving through the ripe, peppery currant and plum flavors. Finishes with chewy tannins. Best from 2004 through 2010. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
note: Deceptively sleek, rich and polished for all its youthful vitality and intensity. Packed with rich currant, cherry, mocha and coffee flavors, it has a deep, complex midpalate, and then the tannins flex their considerable muscles. Best from 2003 through 2012. 4,100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District Estate
note: Absolutely gorgeous, beautifully defined fruit, with uncommon richness and purity of flavor, gushing with ripe currant, blackberry and wild berry fruit, revealing extra facets and dimensions, with a long, intricate, detailed finish. Firmly tannic, but a wealth of fruit pushes through. Best from 2003 through 2012. 1,300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Wonderfully rich, intense and concentrated Cabernet, with layers of tightly focused currant, black cherry, anise, sage and cedary oak. Given all its flavor and richness, there's a sense of elegance and finesse. Well-integrated tannins provide an excellent balance to the rich flavors. Best from 2003 through 2012. 2,443 cases made.

name: Les Pavots Knights Valley
note: Deliciously rich, smooth and polished. Deeply concentrated, with layers of currant, blackberry, mocha and vanilla. Beautifully focused and deftly balanced, the flavors run on and on. Best from 2004 through 2013. 2,164 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Smooth, rich and elegant. This is a supple, deeply flavored, harmonious wine, with focused currant, cassis and blackberry flavors that are pure and succulent. Finishing with ripe, well-integrated tannins and a burst of fruit. Drink now through 2012. 6,950 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley Reserve
note: Plump and generous, dark-colored and amazingly supple, offering pretty plum, blackberry and sweet spice flavors that linger on the polished finish. Drink now through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
note: Rich in flavor and beautifully focused to show its currant, plum and berry flavors, which cascade juicily and generously on the long, long finish. All of it balances impeccably. Drink now through 2008. 2,030 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River Art Series
note: Brilliant, juicy and multilayered, brimming with apple, pear, tropical fruit, almond, mineral and spice flavors that swirl together on a muscular but lithe and seamless frame. The flavors last and last. Has depth, length and power without being at all bulky. Drink now through 2011. 3,000 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
note: One whiff and you know this is serious stuff. The aromas of baking brioche, coconut, candied citrus and leather pick up roasted coffee and grilled nuts on the palate, permeating the senses. Profound depth and complexity, offering a unique Champagne experience. Drink now through 2006. 40,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville
note: Dark, rich and enormously complex, with a solid core of black cherry, plum, currant, anise and cedar flavors. Beautifully focused, with a sense of elegance and finesse. Best from 2003 through 2010. 8,400 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
note: Smooth-textured, with polished currant, mocha, cranberry and cherry, plus touches of tobacco, coffee and spice. A bit tough-edged with tannin, but certainly not out of line for a young wine. Best from 2003 through 2009. 10,000 cases made.

name: Syrah McLaren Vale Balmoral
note: A bit more aristocratic than most Aussie Shirazes, this one strikes a beautiful chord of rich blackberry and currant fruit, hinting at anise and pepper. Has a fleshy frame, with sweet spicy notes darting in and out through the long, harmonious finish. Drink now through 2010. 10,000 cases made.

name: Hermitage
note: A gentle giant of a wine. Subtle and elegant Hermitage, layered with seductive aromas and flavors, from tobacco to green olive, roasted game, mineral and blackberries. Silky mouthfeel, this medium-bodied red is smooth, yet also fresh on the long finish. Will age for years. Drink now through 2015. 7,330 cases made.

name: Barolo Carobric
note: Very well-done. Bright fruit, with hints of dry porcini that turn to blackberries. Full-bodied, with loads of silky tannins and a medium finish. Best after 2005. 1,600 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Australia Individual Vineyard
note: Smooth and generous, an inviting red that's plump with black cherry, blackberry and exotic spice flavors, hinting at dark chocolate as the flavors persist on the fine-grained finish. Outstanding. Drink now through 2004. 20,000 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore
note: Fantastic white. Lovely aromas of fresh green apples, grapefruit and peaches. Full-bodied and very rich, with intense fruit and a long, long finish. A super Soave. Drink now through 2005. 20,000 cases made.

name: Corton-Charlemagne
note: Clearly made in Burgundy, this is a savage wine, a highly distinctive Chardonnay. Immensely powerful, penetrating the palate with a concentrated lemon, honey, wet earth, ripe fruit combination. Full-bodied, it lasts for over a minute on the finish. Best from 2004 through 2020. 1,300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: A rich, deftly balanced style, loaded with complex earthy currant, black cherry, anise, coffee and mocha flavors that are sharply focused. Long and concentrated on the finish, with a leathery streak working its way in. Best from 2003 through 2009. 10,000 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
note: Very rich and distinctive, with spicy currant, leather, tobacco, cedar and mocha aromas and complex, concentrated, earth, currant, spice and cedar flavors. Gains depth and nuance on the finish, where the flavors run deep and long. Tannins are firm and well-integrated. Drink now through 2012. 3,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Reserve
note: Jazzy, snazzy and vibrant. A juicy mouthful of grapefruit, pear and sweet pea, with aromas and flavors that linger on and on, as the finish finds a wonderful equilibrium. Drink now. 12,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros Dijon Clones
note: A bold mouthful of Chardonnay that packs in lots of rich, complex flavors that are concentrated and deep. Smoky toasty oak, pear, fig, sage and anise turn thick and buttery. Drink now through 2006. 15,000 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne
note: A well-rounded, balanced sparkler, showing hazelnut, citrus and honey flavors, augmented by toast, well-integrated with the medium body and lively structure. Drink now through 2004. 50,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros Red Shoulder Ranch
note: Intense and spicy, with an underlying sense of elegance and finesse. Layers of nutmeg and cedary oak match up well with a core of ripe pear, fig, citrus and apricot, finishing with a long, rich, complex aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 7,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District
note: Dark, rich and polished, with ripe currant, black cherry, plum and mocha. It's dense and concentrated, with a long, focused and persistent stream of flavors. Ripe tannins are plush and complex. Best from 2004 through 2012. 9,200 cases made.

name: Toscana Toro Desiderio
note: Big and ripe red, with loads of black licorice, tar and sultanas. Full-bodied, with big, velvety, chewy tannins. Long, ripe fruit aftertaste. A blockbuster. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2005. 3,750 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Canoe Ridge Estate Vineyard
note: Rich, round and generous with its ripe blackberry, cherry and sweet spice flavors, which echo beautifully on the velvety finish. Drink now through 2006. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
note: Bright, ripe and zingy, with grapefruit, pear and celery notes that linger enticingly through the vivid finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Old Vine
note: A big, ripe, expressive style that packs in lots of spicy blackberry and black cherry fruit, and manages a measure of elegance and finesse given its size and intensity. Finishes with hints of herb and tea. Drink now through 2009. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
note: Lively, jazzy style absolutely brims with racy lime, green apple, passion fruit and guava flavors, which linger effortlessly on the polished, vibrant finish. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Adelaide Hills Thomas Hyland
note: Silky, supple and creamy, beautifully balanced to layer its intense nectarine, pear, lime and cream flavors, which linger effortlessly on the elegant finish. Drink now through 2008. 14,390 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Puente Alto Marqués de Casa Concha
note: Delicious Old World-style Cab, with ripe currant and cassis fruit accentuated by mineral, loam, smoke and earth notes. Ripe and juicy, with lovely mouthfeel, and the tug of gout de terroir on the finish. Back-to-back outstanding efforts for this wine. Drink now through 2005. 24,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Laurène
note: Rich and intense, highly focused to project its aromas and flavors without being heavy. Centers on dazzling raspberry, blackberry, vanilla and roasted game notes that harmonize beautifully on the lively finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain
note: Dark and intense, with a tight, compact, tightly wound band of earth, anise, leather, game meat, currant and blackberry, revealing layers of complexity and concentration before the tannins and cedary oak clamp down. Best from 2005 through 2014. 2,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
note: Pretty aromas of plums, berries and cherries follow through to a full-bodied palate, with a lovely balance of ripe fruit and refined tannins. Long and caressing finish. Drink now. 5,380 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
note: Rich, concentrated yet elegant style, with waves of ripe flavors, supple coffee, currant, black cherry and anise, finishing with dense tannins. Drink now through 2010. 6,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mendoza Catena Agrelo Vineyards
note: Delicious stuff. Juicy, with fig, pineapple and pear flavors, fat texture, and a long, bright finish that lets the flavors hang on. Drink now through 2003. 14,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
note: Bright and juicy, this white is a lively mouthful of melon, citrus, pepper and passion fruit flavors, which linger on the appealing finish. Drink now. 7,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
note: A particularly generous New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc that jumps with ripe pear, citrus and passion fruit aromas and flavors, remarkable for its intensity and freshness. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Verona Palazzo della Torre
note: Beautiful aromas of minerals, berries and violets, with just the right amount of toasted oak. Medium- to full-bodied, with fine tannins, but slightly austere on the finish. Best after 2002. 14,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District
note: Dark, intense and concentrated, with a beefy, peppery edge to the plush currant, mineral, earth and blackberry. Shows of lots of flavor and depth, finishing with a strong currant and mineral aftertaste, and rich tannins. Best from 2004 through 2012. 1,473 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Vieilles Vignes
note: So sleek and clean, this full-bodied red combines beautifully spicy fruit, black currant, licorice and a touch of eucalyptus. Light-footed, it glides on the palate to a long and elegant finish. Seductive. Drink now through 2007. 1,220 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Monte Rosso Vineyard Family Vineyard Selection
note: Impressive for its rich, tight, deeply concentrated core of spice- and anise-laced currant and blackberry flavors. Sharply focused, intense and concentrated, its mouthfilling fruit flavors are long and complex on the finish, with well-integrated tannins. Best from 2004 through 2014. 1,365 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Eroica
note: Bright and tangy, with an uncanny balance that finds the right mix of peach, pear and mineral flavors, juicy but nicely concealed acidity, and enough richness to make it all sing through the long, elegant finish. Drink now through 2007. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: Gorgeous aromas of blackberries, violets and currants lead to this full-bodied wine with velvety tannins. Lovely finish delivers a juicy berry aftertaste. Best after 2004. 16,000 cases made.

name: Claret Napa Valley
note: A supple, elegant style, with a range of herb, currant and green olive that offers complexity, picking up anise, earth and mineral flavors. Pleasantly balanced on the finish. A wine of grace and delicacy. Drink now through 2009. 9,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Grande Valley
note: A wine of finesse and elegance, with intense, vibrant fruit that's ripe and rich, with layers of smoky toasty oak, honeysuckle, fig and melon, turning subtle and polished. Drink now through 2005. 9,630 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Grand Reserve
note: Orchestrates an assortment of ripe cherry, blackberry and currant flavors in a smooth texture. Has fine tannins, picking up toasty, cedary oak on the finish, providing backbone. Best from 2004 through 2012. 4,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve
note: Bright and tangy, a complex and detailed Pinot that sneaks up on you. It is especially appealing for its citrus-scented raspberry and chocolate flavors, which linger effortlessly on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 2,902 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Sbragia Limited Release
note: A rich, complex and deeply concentrated style, with layers of pear, fig, smoke, apricot and honey. Bold and intriguing, it's a mouthful of Chardonnay that both relies on oak and carries it well. Drink now through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

name: Meursault Les Charrons
note: Gorgeous from start to finish. An explosive wine that delivers lemon, ripe fruit, and toasted oak (in manageable doses). Sweet-tasting, but with an impressive mineral note. Beautiful, long, succulent finish. Drink now through 2010. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Appellation Selection
note: Wonderful richness, depth and purity of flavor. Shows layers of black cherry, ripe plum, raspberry and currant, as well as touches of anise and herb. Vanilla and cedar-scented oak linger in the background. Ripe tannins emerge on the long, complex, elegant finish. Best from 2003 through 2010. 2,500 cases made.

name: Justification Paso Robles
note: A ripe, intense, fruit-driven style, with racy, jammy black cherry and blackberry fruit that's well-focused, picking up pretty toasty oak, tar and leather shadings. Holds its focus nicely. Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2009. 2,000 cases made.

name: Douro
note: This Portuguese red bursts in the mouth with intense flavors of cassis, berry and red cherry that are powered by a strong backbone of acidity. Finish of game and bittersweet chocolate. Almost Burgundian in its elegance and balance. Best from 2003 through 2008. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Vintage Selection
note: Ripe, rich and polished, with a tasty array of complex currant, plum and wild berry flavors that are sharply focused, long and detailed on the finish. Tannins are sufficient for cellaring, yet neatly woven into the texture. Beautifully crafted. Best from 2003 through 2012. 6,200 cases made.

name: Chianti Rufina Bucerchiale Riserva
note: Intense aromas of ripe fruit, flowers and hints of wood. Full-bodied, with rich, silky tannins and a long, long finish. A tight and well-structured red for aging. Best after 2004. 3,250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
note: Ripe, rich and expressive style, with loads of tropical fruit, pear, fig, apricot and buttery oak, all neatly woven together. The texture is smooth and polished, with a long, detailed, citrusy aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 13,400 cases made.

name: Stellenbosch
note: Distinctive, packed with currant, cocoa, mineral and meat flavors, followed by ripe, finely grained tannins and a lingering espresso note on the lengthy finish. Concentrated, yet elegant and pure, with grip to spare. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Best from 2003 through 2007. 4,600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Cuvée Sauvage
note: Rich, elegant and stylish, with pretty hazelnut, toasty marshmallow, pear, fig and citrus flavors that are nicely proportioned. Drink now through 2007. 3,600 cases made.

name: Umbria White Cervaro della Sala
note: Wonderful aromas of apple pie, honey and cream follow through to a full body, with toasted coconut and rich tropical fruit on the palate. Very long. Always an excellent white. Chardonnay and Grechetto. Drink now. 13,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
note: Rich, complex, refined yet flavor-packed style, with lots of rich pear, fig, hazelnut and melon flavors accented by spicy, toasty oak. Finishes with a long, detailed aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 60,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
note: Smooth and silky, with ripe, rich blackberry, currant and black cherry flavors that are pure and well-focused. Finishes with a long, concentrated aftertaste, with elegant tannins. Drink now through 2009. 50,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Australia Kalimna Bin 28
note: Rich and ripe, plush in texture, brimming with cherry, mineral and licorice flavors, wrapping extrafine tannins around the long finish. Drink now through 2006. 13,000 cases imported.

name: Haut-Médoc
note: Displays very good concentration for the vintage. Aromatic, with plum, currant and tar character, the wine is medium- to full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a medium finish. Super buy. Best after 2003. 21,665 cases made.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek
note: Rich and delicious, a lip-smacking mouthful of blackberry, currant, blueberry and plum flavors wrapped in a blanket of exotic spices, with hints of coffee and chocolate. Tannins are fine and chewy. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara-Monterey Castello
note: A richly flavored yet elegantly crafted wine that's sleek and polished, with ripe pear, fig, honeysuckle and honeydew flavors that turn smooth and creamy, picking up subtle nutmeg and hazelnut nuances on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 2,466 cases made.

name: Greco di Tufo
note: An outstanding modern-style wine from an ancient Italian grape variety. Wonderful aromas of blanched almonds, dried peach, pineapple and minerals. Medium- to full-bodied, with lovely fresh fruit, flinty character and a long, long finish. Excellent. Drink now. 66,650 cases made.

name: Toscana Campaccio
note: Beautiful aromas of sweet plums, licorice and minerals. Full-bodied, with lots of vanilla and berry character, fine tannins and a long, fruity finish. Delicious. Give it some time to come together. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2004. 10,415 cases made.

name: Barolo
note: Clean and balanced. Beautiful aromas of plums, flowers and fresh-brewed Indian tea. Medium-bodied, with ultrafine tannins and a long, caressing finish. A beauty. Best after 2004. 20,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
note: This luscious red offers vanilla, rose and berry aromas that carry through on the creamy palate. Ripe tannins underpin the fruit, but melt into the mix. A spicy, floral finish brings you back for another sip. Drink now through 2007. 18,000 cases made.

name: Montsant Laurona
note: Powerful oaky flavors dominate this red now, but they wrap around a core of luscious raspberry and blackberry fruit flavors, and the texture is smooth and opulent. An ambitious wine in the modern style. Carignane, Grenache, Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2004 through 2012. 4,300 cases made.

name: St.-Estèphe
note: Very fine indeed, offering complex aromas of berries, grilled meat and tobacco, with racy tannins and a long finish. Medium- to full-bodied. Better than from barrel. Best after 2005. 18,715 cases made.

name: Viño de la Tierra de Castilla y León
note: Harmony and finesse mark this elegant red. It offers black cherry, toast and spice flavors over firm tannins, with a grace that almost hides its intensity. A lovely wine in the modern style. Drink now through 2009. 13,000 cases made.

name: Barolo
note: Pretty berry and spicy aromas follow through to a medium to full body, with well-integrated tannins and a coffee, plum and truffle aftertaste. Best after 2005. 7,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
note: Rich and ripe, packed with beautiful currant and berry flavors, framed with superfine tannins that let the fruit and subtly spicy overtones linger effortlessly on the long finish. Drink now through 2010. 2,329 cases made.

name: Toscana Cepparello
note: Incredibly well-crafted red. Complex aromas of raspberries, vanilla and coffee. Medium-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a long, silky finish. A beauty. Best after 2004. 4,250 cases made.

name: Merlot Spring Mountain District
note: A magnificent Merlot, with gorgeous fruit that's ripe, rich and distinctive. The bounty of complex flavors includes enticing black cherry, currant, blackberry and spice, with a smooth chocolaty aftertaste. Drink now through 2012. 2,510 cases made.

name: St.-Estèphe
note: Absolutely gorgeous on the nose, with currants, blackberries and freshly cut flowers. Full-bodied, with ultrafine tannins and a solid core of fruit. This goes on and on on the palate. The essence of class and refinement. Relatively good value, considering the superb quality. No better Cos since 1989.  Best after 2010. 20,830 cases made.

name: Clos Apalta Rapel Valley
note: A stunner. This coats the palate with cassis, blackberry and boysenberry fruit, but stays focused and pure, with vanilla, spice and toast notes chiming in on the palate for added effect. The finish then resonates with purity. A thoroughly seductive wine that glides effortlessly, despite its obvious power and depth. Carmenère, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2009. 3,000 cases made.

name: Priorat
note: Suave, sophisticated, rich and concentrated, but remains balanced and polished, with bright blueberry and blackberry flavors supported by toasty, vanilla-scented oak. A modern wine with great structure and harmony. Best after 2005. 1,800 cases made.

name: St.-Julien
note: Absolutely fantastic. This is one of the most exciting young reds I have tasted in a long, long time. It shows intense aromas of berries, currants and minerals, with hints of mint. Full-bodied and packed with fruit and tannins, its long finish is refined and silky. A benchmark for the vintage. Las Cases has always wanted to make first-growth quality in a top-notch vintage, and it certainly did in 2000. Best after 2012. 15,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley RWT
note: Rich in character and aristocratic in structure, a noble red that wears its subtle cherry, blackberry, chocolate, pepper and sweet spice flavors on a polished frame like a bespoke suit, letting them all play out elegantly on the well-buffed finish. Drink now through 2015. 3,800 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
note: Blockbuster. Both modern and traditional, a full-bodied red that bridges the past and the present. This is packed with Turkish delight dessert, ripe and sweet fruit, lush tannins, with lots of spicy, smoky character and a round, caressing feel in the midpalate. Best from 2006 through 2012. 5,830 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
note: A completely seductive and appealing '01 spätlese. Seamless and airy in texture, yet layered with peach, citrus and mineral aromas and flavors enmeshed in the delicate frame. Lovely finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
note: Smells like freshly picked orchids, with loads of ripe, clean fruit. Full-bodied, medium sweet and very powerful and racy. It lasts for minutes on your palate. Yet there's a balance and class to this young Vintage Port. This is the greatest glass of Graham I have ever tasted, young or old. Best after 2014. 9,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Oreno
note: Dark, with fantastic aromas of currant, blackberry, spice and lightly toasty oak. Full-bodied, with very well-integrated tannins and a texture as fine as the best cashmere from Scotland. Superb. Needs time in the bottle to show its full potential. One of the new hot wines of Tuscany. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2008. 3,330 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Bella's Garden
note: Rich, dense and distinctive for its pepper and exotic spice notes weaving through the chewy cherry pie, dried blueberry and coffee flavors, echoing forever on the long, long finish. Drink now through 2020. 400 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Ritchie Vineyard
note: Wonderful aromas of flowers, honeysuckle, fig, butter and hazelnut. Rich, silky flavors that are elegant and refined, with a creamy, citrus-laced finish. Vibrant acidity gives it backbone and sustains the flavors on a long, minerally aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 702 cases made.

name: Uriah Walla Walla Valley
note: Gloriously ripe, decadent and complex, offering coffee-scented blackberry, currant, cherry and exotic spice aromas and flavors that extend and expand on the subtle, elegant finish. A graceful wine that packs in plenty of flavor and lasts and lasts. Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2010. 900 cases made.

name: St.-Julien
note: The nose shows loads of plum, spice and meat aromas, as well as hints of licorice. It's full-bodied, with firm, yet velvety textured tannins. It's big and rounded. If you can't afford Las Cases, try some of this. Some might call this a second wine, but it comes from a plot of vineyards not deemed worthy of Léoville Las Cases. So it's like its own estate. Best after 2009. 20,000 cases made.

name: Coteaux du Languedoc Pic St.-Loup Cupa Numismae
note: Pure, intense red, with delicious red plum, berry, game and spice flavors on a muscular frame. Pepper and leathery notes linger appealingly on the finish. Almost Hermitage-like in its structure.  Drink now through 2006. 4,700 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
note: Now we are talking. Wow. Aromas of licorice, flowers and crushed blackberries. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with lovely smooth, fine tannins and a long, sweet fruit finish. Greatest young Vintage Port of Smith Woodhouse I have ever tasted. Best after 2014. 4,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Niederhäuser Hermannshöhle
note: A beautifully understated spätlese, with subtle power, density and length. The passion fruit, sweet corn, berry, fennel and mineral notes are layered and just keep coming at you. Superbly balanced, it seems effortless and ethereal. The finish just melts away. Best from 2005 through 2020. 250 cases made.

name: Syrah Edna Valley Reva
note: Deep purple, with loads of ripe plum, black cherry and blackberry flavors, scents of violets, dark fruits, new leather, currants and minerals. A real mouthful that manages to show elegance and a measure of finesse. Long, gushing aftertaste. Drink now through 2012. 850 cases made.

name: Douro Chryseia
note: Essence of blackberry, dark cherry and smoke make this an alluring and distinctive red. Intense concentration and a firm structure provide loads of power. Dark chocolate notes dominate the finish. Still quite youthful, but should develop nicely in the years ahead. Best from 2004 through 2008. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Winemaker's Reserve
note: A rich, flamboyant style, from its wonderful aromatics to its opulent display of fruit and oak flavors. The mix of fleshy pear, fig and smoky oak combine to open all kinds of flavor doors. Finishes with mineral and lemon-citrus scents. Drink now through 2006. 1,958 cases made.

name: Coteaux du Languedoc La Méjanelle Cuvée Sommelière
note: Full-bore, decadent red, with dark plum and blackberry flavors. Bacon fat notes mixed in. Rich, deep and lush, with dark chocolate and espresso notes on the finish. Powerful. Drink now through 2005. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
note: Tangy, with bold citrus, melon, green apple and mineral flavors that grow as they linger effortlessly. Beautifully put together, this has all the earmarks of becoming great with cellaring. Best from 2005 through 2010. 600 cases imported.

name: Barbaresco Basarin
note: Incredibly rich, with masses of ripe fruit on the nose, from plum to blackberry, showing smoky oak undertones. Full-bodied, with layers of silky, ripe tannins and a long, fruity, almost jammy finish. A real triumph. Moccagatta is a leader in Barbaresco right now, and this is one of the greatest wines ever from this producer. Best after 2010. 550 cases made.

name: St.-Julien
note: A dense and rich red, with aromas of blackberries and blueberries, with an undertone of minerals. Full-bodied, with lots of tannins and loads of structure and length. Just a baby, but already muscular and developed. Best wine from this estate in years. Same owner as Léoville Barton. Best after 2010. 7,580 cases made.

name: St.-Julien
note: Extremely well-done. Beautifully aromatic, with coffee, cedar and blackberries on the nose. Full-bodied, with fine tannins and a mineral, blackberry aftertaste with medium fine tannins. I haven't had a Lagrange of this quality in years. Best after 2010. 25,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Edna Valley West Slope Edna Ranch
note: Remarkably complex and elegant, with a delicious range of flavors built around vibrant pear, nectarine, honeysuckle, creamy fig and light toasty-hazelnut scented oak. Turns sleek and vibrant, with a wonderful aftertaste of complex flavors. Drink now through 2005. 4,362 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
note: Big and concentrated red, with plum, berry, currants and cherry character. Full-bodied, with thick tannins and a long, rich finish. Dense wine. As impressive as the 1997. Best after 2004. 2,250 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
note: Crackling, live-wire Sauvignon, with textbook gooseberry, grass, lime and mineral flavors on a racy frame. Pure and long, with great acidity rippling beneath it all. Let this emerge fully in the cellar. Best from 2004 through 2006. 11,500 cases made.

name: Madiran Château Bouscassé Vieilles Vignes
note: Powerful and well-structured red, with dark plum, smoke and dark cherry flavors, and loads of meat and coffee notes. Full-bodied, with licorice and mocha elements on the long, long finish.  Best from 2004 through 2007. 6,600 cases made.

name: Hermitage
note: Ultrarich and ultrathick. A full-bodied, stunningly sweet-tasting Northern Rhône, it delivers a ripe mouthfeel and plenty of fruit, mineral and toasty, smoky character. Long, balanced finish. Great Hermitage red from Guigal. Drink now through 2012. 4,580 cases made.

name: Pessac-Léognan
note: Very, very impressive for this estate. Blackberry and cigar tobacco, with hints of toasted oak. Full-bodied, with loads of velvety tannins and a long finish. Best after 2010. 10,000 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Vigneto Brich Ronchi
note: Very attractive aromas of ripe plum, berry and grilled meat. Full-bodied, with lovely fruit and big, silky tannins. The finish is fantastic, with very ripe fruit, yet refined and caressing in texture. Best after 2008. 2,080 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
note: Impressive. A sophisticated red, with a modern accent, showing vanilla, mocha, chocolate and smoke, all of which complement nicely the ripe and sweet fruit. Full-bodied, clean and racy. Harmonious finish. Drink now through 2015. 6,500 cases made.

name: Barolo Pajana
note: Layers and layers of fruit. Intense aromas of blackberry, tobacco, mineral and dried mushroom. Full-bodied, with big velvety tannins and rich and wonderful fruit. Long, long finish. Goes on and on. I like it better than the outstanding 1998. Clerico is a master again. Best after 2010. 550 cases made.

name: Zinfandel San Francisco Bay Carla's Vineyards
note: Dark and chocolaty, with zesty wild berry and blackberry fruit and lots of spice and espresso scents. The long, rich, concentrated aftertaste showcases the exotic fruit flavors. Drink now through 2008. 2,100 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Appellation Series
note: Rich and plump, a flood of fruit, with powerful blackberry, plum and a wee touch of peppermint, all echoing through the long finish. A serious McLaren Vale Shiraz, built to last. Drink now through 2012. 5,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
note: Gorgeous balance and grace in this peach- and mineral-flavored Riesling. Great clarity and delicacy defy the amount of flavors deftly positioned on its lightweght frame. Plenty of snap and a chalky texture on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases made.

name: Toro Termes
note: Blackberry fruit claims center stage in this powerful red, where it mingles with tobacco and coffee notes and plenty of smoky oak. Massive tannins give structure, but the fruit reemerges on the finish.  Best after 2004. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Muscadet de Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie Château de Chasseloir
note: This Muscadet offers rare explosiveness, with concentrated lemon peel, grapefruit, honeysuckle, mineral and briny notes. The racy acidity carries it along effortlessly, while a second wave of fruit emerges on the finish. Hard for Muscadet to be better than this. Drink now through 2004. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch
note: An uncommonly rich, almost sweet-tasting Chardonnay that packs in lots of flavors yet manages to be elegant and refined. It offers layers of fig, apricot and ripe pear, shaded by exotic spices and pretty oak. Drink now through 2007. 3,886 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
note: Old-fashioned, this full-bodied traditional wine seduces with its decadent game, saddle-leather, plum and sautéed wild mushroom aromas. No hint of fancy oak, just a mouthful of Châteauneuf character that swirls around to a long, sweet finish. Another great négoce red from Guigal. Drink now through 2008. 23,330 cases made.

name: Corton-Charlemagne
note: Beautiful white Burgundy, incredibly ripe yet very pure and showing lovely mineral character. Some toasted oak, but mostly ripe pear, tropical and lime notes. Full-bodied, it sings on the palate to a long, long juicy and sweet finish.  Drink now through 2012. 3,200 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
note: Seductive, elegant and refined, with subtle but rich flavors, in a full-bodied package that includes ripe fruit, spice, smoke, plum and quince pie. Tightly wound (but sweet) tannins, and a burst of mineral make this particularly long and clean on the finish. Best from 2007 through 2020. 16,665 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Icon Series
note: Brisk, floral style brims with pear, grapefruit and passion fruit aromas and flavors, which linger effortlessly on the vibrant finish. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Rufina Montesodi
note: A beauty. Dark, with beautiful aromas of blackberry, mineral and spice. Full-bodied, with a solid core of fruit and tannins and a long, long finish. Pure Sangiovese. Best after 2006. 5,800 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
note: Like a laser beam, this wine zaps the palate with ripe apple, peach, citrus and mineral notes, then exits as cleanly as it entered, leaving you wanting more. Drink now through 2006. 3,800 cases made.

name: Merlot Peumo Marqués de Casa Concha
note: Smoky and ripe, with black currant and plum fruit, hints of herbs, cocoa and toast, and fleshy, mouthfilling finish. Feels like it has the stuffing to cellar a bit too. This label is really strong these days. Drink now through 2005. 20,000 cases made.

name: Haut-Médoc
note: Loads of crushed raspberries, minerals and spices on the nose. Full-bodied, and concentrated, yet very refined and tight. A lovely elegant claret. Seriously good. Best after 2005. 13,330 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Old Vine
note: Terrific range of flavors, excellent balance and a wonderful sense of harmony. The mix of blackberry, black cherry, anise, sage and toast make this a most inviting wine. Not shy on muscle or tannic backbone, either, as it's quite chewy on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 7,800 cases made.

name: Pouilly-Fumé Pur Sang
note: This is a powerhouse, with lemon curd, chamomile, honeysuckle, white peach and mineral notes on an incredibly lush frame, yet it's all supported by riveting acidity underneath. Terrific cut and length here, with remarkable persistence on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 1,915 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
note: Bright and generous. Impressively balanced to show touches of ripe melon against tart grapefruit and lime flavors that echo nicely on the lively, delicately herbal finish. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Ugolaia
note: Fabulous bottle. Very, very classy aromas of freshly cut flowers, crushed berries, with hints of cedar. Full-bodied, yet extremely reserved, with fine tannins and impressive fruit. However, it's all in balance. It goes on and on. Best after 2005. 833 cases made.

name: Bandol
note: Rich, bacony aromas and flavors mix with alluring dark plum and red cherry flavors in this broad-tasting, full-bodied red. Intense blood, iron and mineral notes linger with spicy elements on the powerful finish.  Drink now through 2007. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Groenekloof
note: Really fine Sauvignon here--juicy and vibrant, with lemon, chive, chalk, nettle and mineral notes, and a long, lively finish. Strong grassy edge to the finish adds dimension. Drink now through 2004. 11,000 cases made.

name: Haut-Médoc
note: Super effort. Complex aromas of milk chocolate, plum and coffee, with hints of game. Full-bodied, soft and round tannins, with a ripe fruit finish. Lovely wine. Best after 2005. 12,675 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Pfalz Bird Label
note: Brilliance and clarity highlight this Riesling, whose peach, grapefruit and spice notes are brought into focus against the vivid structure. Subtle, lingering finish. Drink now through 2006. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Mudgee Hill of Gold
note: Brighter, livelier and juicier than most Australian Shiraz, a vibrant wine with crisp blackberry, plum and vaguely leafy-herbal flavors that persist beautifully on the harmonious finish. Drink now through 2010. 23,000 cases made.

name: Verona Palazzo della Torre
note: A gorgeous wine. This shows beautiful perfumes of ripe fruit, with hints of spicy oak and dried flowers. Full-bodied, with superfine, silky tannins and a long, long finish. Best from 2004 through 2008. 18,180 cases made.

name: St.-Julien
note: Absolutely wonderful aromas of flowers, currants and citrus. Full-bodied, yet very, very refined, with a center core of fruit that tastes like crushed raspberries and goes on and on. Greatest wine from this estate since 1945. Best after 2010. 18,750 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley Reserve
note: Supple and seductive, a lush mouthful of blackberry, blueberry and plum flavors shaded with some subtlety by black pepper, olive and vanilla notes, all of it lingering effortlessly on the remarkably refined finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore
note: A bright and fruity Soave, with ripe apple and apricot character. Medium-bodied, with good fruit and a long finish. You don't get better than this for value in Italian whites. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Clancy's Barossa
note: Plump and generous, a deep, plush-textured red that bursts with plum, blackberry, vanilla, white pepper and cream flavors, which echo beautifully as the flavors last and last on the gorgeous finish. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2015. 20,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
note: Light in texture, but the flavors pile up nicely, growing from delicate berry to rich plum and spice as they fill the mouth on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 16,373 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Eroica
note: Ripe, fresh and juicy, with immense generosity, brimming with mineral-scented, honey-kissed apricot and peach flavors, supple on the finish and nicely laced with just enough acidity to keep it long and lively. Drink now through 2008. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sancerre
note: Lots to like here, with citrus peel, straw, mineral, lemon curd and peach notes. This bouncy Sancerre has length, vibrancy and balance and begs for food. Delicious. Drink now through 2005. 30,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale The Footbolt Old Vine
note: Bright and jazzy, with delicious blackberry and cherry and subtle touches of anise and pepper weaving through the lively, long finish. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Mencía Bierzo
note: This dark red impresses with its solid structure and good balance. The flavors are muted now, but the concentration is evident, and a core of wild plum and toast notes will open with time. Best from 2004 through 2009. 10,000 cases made.

name: Carmignano Villa di Capezzana
note: This excellent wine is a relatively good value for the quality. Intense aromas of berry, spice and pepper follow through to a full-bodied palate, with silky tannins and a rich finish. Best after 2004. 5,800 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Special Cuvée
note: A beautiful Champagne. Complex and elegant, evoking ginger, jasmine, citrus and honey aromas and flavors, accented by a biscuit and grain component coming as much from barrel fermentation as yeast aging. Very firmly structured and long. Enjoy with Asian foods or Parmesan cheese. Drink now through 2006. 9,500 cases imported.

name: St.-Estèphe
note: Intense coffee, spice and ripe berries on the nose. Full-bodied, with lots of soft and silky tannins and a long, long fruity, berry and vanilla aftertaste. Reminds me of the excellent 1989, which I am still drinking with relish. Excellent value here.  Best after 2007. 24,665 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Alpha Apalta Vineyard
note: Lovely fruit here--cassis, red currant and blackberry--with supple texture. Yet there's serious grip, with mineral, cocoa and toast notes as well, all framed by firm yet well-integrated tannins. This should develop nicely. Drink now through 2006. 20,150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
note: Quite reliant on jazzy oak, but it's also quite rich and concentrated, with appealing currant, black cherry, anise, mineral and leathery notes, finishing with pretty coffee ground notes. Drink now through 2009. 88,858 cases made.

name: Rioja
note: Elegant, vivid and sophisticated, showing pure fruit flavors of blackberry and blueberry, accented by vanilla from oak and kept lively by crisp acidity. Well-proportioned and well-integrated. Drink now through 2012. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
note: Lovely stuff, it manages to be rich in flavor yet delicate in texture, offering raspberry and mint-scented cherry and peppery spice flavors, which linger effortlessly on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
note: Wonderful aromas of spice, blackberry and incense. Full-bodied, with fine tannins and a long, long finish. Very well-crafted.  Best after 2003. 12,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Viña Hormigas Reserva
note: Serious juice here, with deep, vivid purple color, loads of plum, boysenberry and blackberry fruit, extra layers of meat, mineral and toast, and a terrific velvety texture despite the dense, muscular tannins. Drink now through 2007. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley
note: Smooth, rich and concentrated, with a tasty core of plum, blackberry and wild berry shaded by toasty, smoky oak. It all comes together on the finish, where it turns complex and plush. Drink now through 2007. 9,213 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Grande Valley
note: Intense and lively, with freshly squeezed lime and green apple flavors that are enlivened by acidity, giving this a long, fruity, cleansing aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 6,340 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma-Monterey Counties Overlook
note: Loads of rich flavors yet with a sense of elegance and finesse, with layers of ripe, spicy, apple, pear and buttery notes, finishing with lively, well-integrated acidity and a burst of flavor on the aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 18,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Rita Hills Botella
note: Dark, firm, rich and intense, with lots of concentration to the black cherry, blackberry, fresh earth and blueberry jam flavors. Well-focused, with mouthcoating, integrated tannins and a long, pure, rich aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 536 cases made.

name: Stellenbosch
note: Terrific juice, pure and driven, with red and black currant, cassis, bittersweet chocolate, graphite and espresso flavors. Serious depth, with the fruit coursing through the finish despite its youthful tightness. A classy wine. Cellar. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Best from 2004 through 2008. 1,600 cases imported.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz South Australia Bin 389
note: Starts off dark and dense, but quickly finds a sense of elegance that lets the pepper- and licorice-scented blackberry and cherry flavors come sailing through, echoing beautifully on the firm, fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2010. 17,000 cases imported.

name: Priorat Solanes
note: A luscious, velvety texture carries plum, toast, spice and licorice flavors in this generous red. Tannins are big, ripe and round, the finish sweet and spicy. Drink now through 2012. 4,700 cases made.

name: Alluvium Red Knights Valley
note: Dark, rich and polished, with complex, concentrated currant, tobacco, olive, bell pepper and blackberry flavors. Finishes with a flash of spicy, toasty oak and ripe, integrated tannins. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Best from 2004 through 2011. 9,000 cases made.

name: Toro El Albar Excelencia
note: A beauty, in the international style. Dark color, lavish oak, ripe fruit and muscular structure mark this red. Flavors range from cassis to chocolate to mineral. Balanced and deep.  Best from 2005 through 2010. 1,500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal
note: A floral white, delicate and graceful, this combines apple, citrus and mineral flavors with a slim yet medium-bodied frame. Its silky texture and seamlessness reveal its pedigree. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Seven Hills Vineyard
note: A racy, wild, generous Syrah, juicy with lively acidity balancing the raucous blackberry, plum and a whiff of mineral and gamy character that wafts through the long, aromatic finish. Tannins are subdued, and it all holds together nicely. Drink now through 2010. 960 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros
note: Beautifully crafted, sleek, rich and refined, with a tight, elegant beam of spicy pear, citrus, honey and fresh, clean earth. Tapered on the finish, where the flavors are long and detailed. Nary a trace of oak in this classy debut Chardonnay from HdV. Drink now through 2007. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District
note: Beautifully crafted, with wonderful, complex aromas and a smooth, seductive texture. Layers of currant, cedar, herb, coffee, olive and mocha, turning remarkably elegant and supple. Ripe, well-integrated tannins give it a long, flavorful finish. Drink now through 2010.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
note: Gorgeous aromas of plum, blackberry and violet. Full-bodied, with bright, delicious fruit and refined tannins. Long, long finish. As a Chianti Classico riserva should be. Drink now through 2008. 3,300 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero
note: Beautifully polished, complex but balanced, this impressive red shows ripe fruit, judicious oak and a vibrant sense of place. Not overly muscular, but finely proportioned and deeply flavored. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Merlot Napa-Sonoma Counties
note: Beautifully crafted, exquisitely balanced and rich in currant, exotic spice and ripe blackberry fruit. Turns spicy and exhibits pretty mocha-scented oak, with a long, broad, rich aftertaste. Drink now through 2010. 5,320 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Turckheim Herrenweg
note: Lovely richness, fleshing out the honey, litchi and grapefruit peel notes. It gets good support from a moderately firm structure, with a touch of bitterness shoring up the long finish. Best from 2004 through 2008. 1,600 cases made.

name: Barbaresco
note: Beautiful and elegant, with silky, ripe fruit. Medium-bodied, with medium, fine tannins and a caressing finish. Very fine. Excellent value. Best after 2007. 5,400 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Les Pierrets
note: Etched in stone. Dry and tightly wound, this conjures up a limestone cliff after a thunderstorm. Quince and peach also mingle in its rocky depths. Firm and concentrated, this is for rock hounds. Best from 2005 through 2012. 1,000 cases made.

name: Syrah California Roll Ranch Vineyard
note: Simply delicious, overflowing with flavor. Inky dark, ripe, rich and plush, with a load of jammy plum, blackberry, wild berry and spicy aromatics. Finishes with a long, complex aftertaste and a gush of fruit. Tannins are well-integrated. Drink now through 2010. 600 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Vigneto Marcarini
note: A big wine, with fascinating aromas of black licorice, berry and toasted oak. Full-bodied, with loads of ripe fruit and velvety, fruit-coated tannins. Long finish. Easily the best wine from this producer this year due to the richness and balance. Best after 2008. 1,500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Vigna di Pianrosso
note: Wild berry, cherry and floral aromas to this Brunello. Full-bodied, with big, silky tannins and loads of exciting fruit. Lively, yet refined. These wines are a joy to taste. Giuseppe Bianchini is a master in the vineyards.  Best after 2004. 3,900 cases made.

name: Syrah Mount Veeder
note: Tightly wound and firmly concentrated, it opens up to unveil a wealth of rich, exotic spices, with beefy bay leaf, earth and mineral scents to a dense, chewy core of beefy currant, blackberry and new leather, finishing with espresso, mocha and vanilla flavors that make it quite enticing. It should only get better in the next year. Best from 2005 through 2012. 430 cases made.

name: Chassagne-Montrachet Morgeot Vieilles Vignes
note: Fat and rich, with a botrytislike dried apricot, dried peach, fig and honey character. Has the opulence of a grand cru. Silky. Full-bodied and harmonious, but not as long as it could be on the finish.  Drink now through 2010. 700 cases made.

name: Sauternes
note: Like lemon curd on the nose, turning to honey and caramel. Full-bodied and very sweet, with fantastic concentration of ripe and botrytized fruit, yet balanced and refined. Electric acidity. Lasts for minutes on the palate. This is absolutely mind-blowing. This is the greatest young Sauternes I have ever tasted. Best after 2010. 12,500 cases made.

name: Clos Apalta Colchagua Valley
note: Stunning purity, with concentrated plum, boysenberry and raspberry fruit that just glides across the palate, buttressed by superfine yet muscular tannins. Suave toast, coconut butter and spice notes along with alluring chocolate and black tea hints chime in on the long finish. A superb combination of fruit and elegance. Drink now through 2009. 4,885 cases made.

name: Toro Termes
note: Cassis and cocoa notes follow through on the palate of this voluptuous, international-style red. Mouthcoating tannins can't overwhelm the ripe, expressive flavors of cassis, blackberry and kirsch. The wine is fresh and focused, and the long finish echoes with vanilla and Eastern spices.  Best after 2005. 2,000 cases made.

name: Barolo Bric dël Fiasc
note: Very, very ripe fruit, with strawberries and plums galore. Turns to Indian spices and cedar. Full-bodied, with an exquisite palate of ultraripe tannins that turn to velvet. Long, long finish. Cashmere. Great from barrel, great from bottle. This is the best Bric dël Fiasc ever. Best after 2010. 875 cases made.

name: Les Pavots Knights Valley
note: Seductive spicy blackberry, floral and licorice flavors are simply fantastic in a wine that's rich in flavor yet delicately balanced and elegantly styled. This magnificent young wine gushes with ripe, fleshy Cabernet flavors, and while the flavors run deep, it's the balance and suppleness of the tannins that let you savor the wealth of perfectly ripened grapes. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Best from 2006 through 2012. 1,853 cases made.

name: Toscana Masseto
note: Wonderful aromas of blackberries, raspberries and fresh tobacco, with a hint of exotic fruit. Full-bodied, with loads of velvety tannins and a long, long finish. Very silky indeed. A gorgeous, seductive, classy red. A monument to Tuscany. Layers and layers of fruit and tannins. Perhaps the greatest Tuscan red ever. Best after 2012. 2,670 cases made.

name: Pauillac
note: Stick your nose in this and it says something—"I am special." Deep and generous aromas of blackberries, fresh tobacco and minerals. It's full-bodied, with big velvety tannins and a superlong finish. Like a fine cashmere sweater. Best after 2010. 22,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Reserve
note: Dark, deep and powerful, an explosive wine, positively vibrating with ultraripe raspberry, blackberry, licorice, sweet peppers and spices, all balanced with juicy acidity and finishing with remarkable harmony and tremendous length. A real knockout. Best after 2006. 800 cases made.

name: Sauternes
note: Gorgeous aromas of honey, passion fruit, mango and candied lemon rind. Full-bodied and ultraconcentrated, yet balanced and refined. It lasts for minutes on the palate. This has just about everything in the right place. Stunning. Best after 2009. 6,665 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Flaccianello
note: Monumental, with masses of blackberry, coffee, berry and cherry aromas. Full-bodied, with layers of ripe tannins. Goes on and on. Builds on the palate. I have never tasted a greater wine from here. Better than 1997. Best after 2007. 4,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Sonoma
note: Wonderful balance and sense of elegance, it offers vivid ripe fruit flavors that are rich and complex, with spicy black cherry, blackberry, pomegranate, herb and sage notes that add flavor dimensions and complexity. Firm, but ripe tannins add structure, allowing the fruit to push through. Drink now through 2009. 48,000 cases made.

name: Alec's Blend Napa Valley
note: A stunning effort. Wonderful fragrant aromas of violets, vanilla bean, espresso and tiers of black cherry and blackberry fruit. This is an unusually fruity and complex wine that is quite reliant on oak for some of its flavors, but also a wealth of rich, concentrated dark berry flavors, finishing with a long, luxurious finish. Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne
note: Sensuous, aromatic and harmonious, evoking toast, candied citrus, hazelnut and mineral aromas and flavors; reminiscent of a white Burgundy, with bubbles. Impeccably balanced and finely textured, the finish echoes with toast and candied fruit notes. Drink now through 2008. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Rutherford
note: Brilliant yellow-gold color, superrich and multifaceted, with layers of rich, creamy fig, citrus, pear and honeysuckle. This deliciously full-blown wine is deeply concentrated, finishing with a long, persistent aftertaste, picking up a cedar, smoke and toasty oak nuance that adds another dimension. Drink now through 2009. 960 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Castelgiocondo
note: A tight and chewy wine, with full body and lots of raisin and spice character. Impressive, ripe tannins. Thick and powerful; needs time in the bottle. From one of the most serious producers in Montalcino now.  Best after 2007. 21,660 cases made.

name: Puente Alto
note: This brick house of a wine shows plenty of Pauillac-like hints of iron, dried currant and cigar smoke, but also has layers of Chilean loam, blackberry, plum, spice and minerals. A powerful performance in a powerful vintage. Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2005 through 2012. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
note: You won't find many Chardonnays in this class. Ultrarich and multidimensional, with a fabulous array of creamy flavors built around a core of fig, apricot, crème brûlée and roasted marshmallows. Full-bodied, yet elegant and concentrated, it weaves the tapestry of flavors to a long, rich, graceful finish. Drink now through 2009. 2,016 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
note: A rich, stylish wine with concentrated layers of ripe fig, apricot and honeysuckle, turning elegant and polished, with a long, rich finish. Drink now through 2006. 64,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
note: Lithe in texture, vivid in flavor, with a burst of black cherry, currant, huckleberry, cedar, vanilla and exotic spice flavors that hang together beautifully. Rich from the first sip, and the flavors persist impressively. Yum. Drink now through 2012. 1,350 cases made.

name: Douro
note: Powerful, intense and concentrated red, with robust flavors of dark plum, dark cherry and spice, all tightly wrapped but generous and deep. Smoke and dark chocolate notes emerge on the long, refined finish. A stunning red from the wilds of the Douro. Touriga Nacional, Touriga Francesca, Tinta Roriz, Tinta Barroca and Tinto Cão. Best from 2005 through 2008. 2,160 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Paarl
note: This pulls no punches, with lots of grilled hazelnut, matchstick and piecrust aroma followed by ripe pear, fig and melon flavors. Long, smoky finish delivers another wave of fruit. Drink now through 2005. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Sbragia Limited Release
note: A superrich, multifaceted Chardonnay brimming with exotic ripe pear, fig and honeysuckle flavors overlaid by smoky, toasty, roasted marshmallow oak, finishing with a long, saturated, unctuous aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauternes
note: Golden yellow. Butterscotch and vanilla, with hints of ripe apples. Full-bodied, with lots of sweetness and a spicy apricot and honey aftertaste. Excellent concentration and balance. Loads of botrytis character on the finish. Intense. Hard not to drink now because it's so luscious and rich. Best after 2008. 11,665 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River Art Series
note: Seamless, harmonious and seductive, its gorgeous cascade of pear, pineapple, guava, nectarine and subtle spice aromas and flavors flowing across the palate like a babbling brook in a Japanese garden. Amazingly refined and built to last, but it feels utterly complete already. The finish just sails on and on. Drink now through 2020. 4,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley The Beaux Frères Vineyard
note: Big and ripe, a mouthwatering wine with tingly acidity bringing harmony to a wash of plum, blackberry, cherry and dusky spice flavors, which persist on the fine-grained, not terribly tannic finish. Drink now through 2012. 2,599 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Puente Alto Don Melchor
note: Terrific personality, with prune, cocoa, loam, mineral, dark currant, blackberry, tar and sanguine flavors that don't quit. Well-structured, with fine balance and harmony already and a very long finish. Best from 2005 through 2010. 15,200 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Command
note: Big and powerful, brimming with tarry, spicy black cherry, dark plum, blackberry and chocolate flavors. Rich and gooey like a warm flourless chocolate cake, yet it finds a plush balance that keeps it from veering off into heaviness. This has grace, harmony and refinement, without losing an ounce of power. Drink now through 2025. 600 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Victoria
note: Bright, juicy and lively with blackberry, huckleberry, white pepper and a refined floral character that melds beautifully through the finish, and the tremendous aftertaste just doesn't quit. A stylish Shiraz that should keep giving for years. Best from 2006 through 2015. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
note: This wine shows an incredible concentration of fruit, with loads of berries and spices on the nose. Full-bodied, with soft and silky tannins and lots of smoky character. Goes for a long time on the finish. Always a benchmark for the region. Best after 2005. 55,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Reserve
note: Ripe, polished, opulent style teems with spicy black cherry, raspberry, black olive, bay leaf and sweet spice flavors, which echo against the superfine tannins on the long, generous finish. Drink now through 2013. 4,000 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
note: Dark and dense, this very powerful Châteauneuf oozes dark chocolate, black currant, tar, mineral, grilled beef and roasted chestnut flavors that just won't quit. Yet despite its exotic range of flavors, it has a pure, silky core of fruit that remains steadfast through the extremely long finish. An awesome young wine. Best from 2006 through 2024. 2,350 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
note: Classy, elegant red with plum, berry and soft mineral character. Medium- to full-bodied, with silky tannins and a long, long minerally finish. Best after 2005. 2,055 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley
note: Ripe, beautifully focused and generous, a delicious mouthful of blackberry, cherry, blueberry, plum and exotic spice flavors that just don't quit, hinting at smoke and meat on the lithe, elegant finish. Impressive for its balance of power and grace. Drink now through 2012. 1,360 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley Eisele Vineyard
note: An exceptional bottling that offers a veritable explosion of hay, lemon blossom, grass, melon and nectarine notes. Tangy acidity, supple cream tones, anise and mineral nuances weave through a finish of superior depth and dimension. Doesn't get much better than this. Drink now through 2006. 1,300 cases made.

name: Pouilly-Fumé La Porte de L'Abbaye
note: This offers layers of streamlined flint, lime, lemon curd, smoke, green almond and dried herbs, all running through a long finish that never breaks stride. Drink now through 2008. 12,500 cases made.

name: Syrah Viño de Mesa de Toledo Dominio de Valdepusa
note: Powerful aromas of anise, game and tar may be too strong for some, but they morph into ripe blackberry, cassis, espresso, black pepper, licorice and mineral flavors on the palate. The texture is plush, the tannins massive but well-integrated, and the fruit sails on the finish. Ambitious red in the full-blown international style. Drink now through 2010. 4,000 cases made.

name: St.-Estèphe
note: Wonderful spice and currant aromas to this young wine. Full-bodied, with super well-integrated, refined tannins. Long caressing finish. This is very, very silky. Just like from barrel. Cos is on top of it now. Best after 2008. 17,705 cases made.

name: The Struie Barossa Valley
note: Ripe, round and decadent, plush in texture, oozing with tarry, chocolaty plum and black cherry flavors that linger beautifully. Picks up all kinds of spicy notes as the finish goes on and on. Should only get deeper with age. Drink now through 2020. 2,500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
note: Beautiful spice, berry, plum and raspberry character with hints of spices. Full-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a long, long finish. This is always one of the greatest producers of Brunello and 1999 is no different. If you couldn't get his 1997 (97 points), buy this.  Best after 2006. 2,000 cases made.

name: Barolo Bricco Fiasco
note: The nose of this wine evokes crushed Nebbiolo, with hints of fresh flowers and Indian spices. Full-bodied, with incredibly round, soft tannins. Long, velvety finish. Voluptuous. Azelia has come into its own. Serve this to the nonbelievers. Best after 2008. 1,040 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles Richard Sauret Vineyard
note: Intense and rich in flavor, with smoky, toasty oak wrapped snugly around a core of plum and blackberry fruit, turning complex as they fold together on the finish, ending with a chocolate espresso bean aftertaste. Drink now through 2009. 2,858 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Sophia's Cuvee
note: Appealing for its exuberant display of ripe, fleshy blackberry and wild berry fruit. It adds a pretty touch of floral and cedar nuances before revealing its depth, richness and concentration on a long, persistent, impressive finish that keeps the flavors lively and flowing. Drink now through 2012. 1,375 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Crianza
note: This distinctive red is graceful on the palate, but has an intensity that amplifies and focuses its ripe fruit and toasty oak flavors, driving them across the palate and into the long, long finish. It's not showy, but the longer you linger, the more it delivers. Drink now through 2015. 7,600 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
note: Explosively aromatic, brimming with spice, herb and peppery character, surprisingly docile in the mouth, with lovely pear, apple, melon and mineral flavors that linger enticingly. Impeccably balanced. Drink now. 60,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley RWT
note: Ripe and open-textured, rife with cherry, currant and blueberry jam flavors, subtlety shaded with spicy, slightly smoky overtones that linger along with the fruit on a very persistent finish. A hint of melted wax that is intriguing as well. Best from 2005 through 2015. 8,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
note: Phenomenal wine, with seductive spicy, mocha and chocolaty oak aromas and ripe, rich, plush currant and blackberry flavors that are deeply concentrated; reveals extra layers of complexity and depth and finishes with a potent burst of ripe flavors. No denying its tannic strength, but this wine packs a wallop of fruit as well. Drink now through 2012. 1,180 cases made.

name: Syrah Edna Valley Reva
note: Tremendous; dark, dense, rich and concentrated, with layers of beef carpaccio, blackberry, wild berry, exotic peppery spices and touches of tar and herbs, finishing with a long, rich, detailed finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,450 cases made.

name: Montsant Castell de Falset
note: Expressive aromas of black currants and coffee follow through on the muscular palate, amplified by anise, tobacco and mineral notes. When the tannins give way, the finish is clean and long. A full-throttle red that achieves power without ever losing control. Grenache, Cabernet Sauvignon, Carignane and Tempranillo. Best from 2006 through 2014. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Bandol
note: Intense and seductive red, with loads of dark cherry, blackberry and kirsch flavors spread out over a powerful and robust frame. Mouthcoating tannins give it added muscle. Smoky notes mix with dark chocolate on the long, fresh, mineral-laden finish. Tempting now.  Best from 2005 through 2009. 1,170 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros
note: Excellent intensity, focus and concentration, with layers of creamy, smoky fig, citrus, pear and hazelnut. Remarkably elegant and polished, finishing with subtle, pleasing flavor nuances. Drink now through 2007. 2,937 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Angel's Share
note: Not a huge mouthful, but it unfolds its flavors and builds up intensity as the blackberry, plum, cedar and floral pepper flavors persist onto the long, generous finish. Best from 2007 through 2015. 2,200 cases imported.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Grand Estates
note: Ripe, plump and generous with its fresh cherry, dried cherry, dark plum and sweet spice flavors, nicely framed with toasty oak as the fruit persists impressively on the long finish. Drink now through 2009. 310,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Reserva
note: Terrific core of blackberry, black fig and boysenberry fruit, with lush toast, cocoa powder and loam notes as well. Juicy and long, with a powerful finish. Jump on it. Drink now through 2008. 3,500 cases imported.

name: Chianti Classico Cellole Riserva
note: Phenomenal nose, with complex smoky, tarry, licoricelike red fruit aromas. Full-bodied, with added tobacco and vanilla coming through on the palate, with silky tannins and a long, minerally finish. One of the best Chianti Classicos I've ever tasted. Best after 2005. 2,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Otis Vineyard David Lake Signature Series
note: Smooth and polished, an elegant red with depth of flavor that sneaks up on you. Currant, blackberry, smoky spice and dried tomato flavors compete for attention, building in intensity as the fine tannins subside on the long finish. Best from 2006 through 2015. 2,380 cases made.

name: Merlot Spring Mountain District
note: Ripe, rich, juicy and polished, with layers of currant, black cherry and plum that are deeply concentrated, elegant and lively. A light overlay of toasty, mocha-scented oak adds another flavor dimension, and the flavors linger on a long, zesty aftertaste. A delicious Merlot that's a worthy successor to the stellar '01.  Drink now through 2009. 1,650 cases made.

name: Tokaji Aszú 5 Puttonyos
note: Gorgeous, silky and harmonious, offering orange blossom, honey and beeswax aromas and flavors. Lightweight, elegant and vibrant, it carries its sweetness with poise, ending with freshness and a long aftertaste of honey. Drink now through 2020. 1,250 cases made.

name: Margaux
note: Incredible aromas of flowers, currants, blackberries, and minerals. Full-bodied, with a supersolid core of fruit, incredibly finely knit tannins and a finish that goes on and on. This is really superb. Much better than from barrel. Giscours is really going places. Best after 2009. 26,665 cases made.

name: Goat-Roti Western Cape
note: This just oozes fruit--blackberries, plums and currants--but has firm tannins to keep it from getting to gushy. Lots of tar, smoke and dark chocolate here too, with the fruit pumping through the finish. Shiraz with five percent Viognier. Drink now through 2005. 7,000 cases imported.

name: Barolo
note: Focused and dense plum and blackberry fruit on the nose. Full-bodied, jammy and rich. Soft tannins. Fruit-forward. Best after 2008. 5,000 cases made.

name: Firehouse Red Columbia Valley
note: Polished, focused and impressive for its pure currant and blackberry fruit, nicely shaded with hints of mineral and a whisper of red pepper. The flavors linger enticingly against fine, crisp tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2012. 4,312 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
note: Wonderful fragrant aromas of flowers and ripe cherry and wild berry, which transfer over to a smooth, rich, polished style that caresses the palate, turning silky and delicate. Finishes with vivid black cherry and blackberry fruit and touches of vanilla and spice. Drink now through 2008. 3,275 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Rita Hills Southing
